For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/postgres/upgrade-major-db-version-inplace#plan-upgrade">Plan a major version upgrade</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dialogflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Dialogflow CX</strong> now offers custom webhook templates for integration with Salesforce. See the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/webhook#predefined-template">webhooks documentation</a> for details.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Data store agents</strong>: You can now run <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/data-store-agent-performance#evaluation">self-service evaluation</a> which will assess the quality of your data store agent and recommend changes.</p>\n<h3>Deprecated</h3>\n<p><strong>All generative features</strong>: It was <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/release-notes#March_25_2024">announced previously</a> that the text-bison-001 model will be deprecated. In addition, the code-bison@001 model and fine-tuned text-bison@001 options will be deprecated. This deprecation will happen mid June.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Data store agents</strong>: The gemini-1.5-flash generative model is now available for selection in the console.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Architecture Center</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/rag-capable-gen-ai-app-using-vertex-ai">Infrastructure for a RAG-capable generative AI application using Vertex AI</a>: Added a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/rag-capable-gen-ai-app-using-vertex-ai#design_alternative">design alternative</a> that uses Vertex AI Vector Search for the vector store and semantic search components in the architecture.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/cadvisor-kubelet-metrics">Fully managed cAdvisor/Kubelet metrics</a> are now available on GKE clusters running version 1.29.3-gke.1093000 or later. </p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Updated <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/release-notes#May_08_2024">2024-R13 release notes</a> to indicate that control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Regular channel were <em>not</em> upgraded from version 1.28 to version 1.29.1-gke.1589018. That release note was published by mistake.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Sensitive Data Protection</h2>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>From May 27 through June 7, 2024, a bug caused Sensitive Data Protection to sometimes inaccurately populates integer fields as null instead of zero for findings written to BigQuery. This bug is now resolved.</p>\n\n<p>For more information about sensitive data inspection, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sensitive-data-protection/docs/inspecting-storage">Inspect Google Cloud storage and databases for sensitive data</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Workbench</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now create a Vertex AI Workbench instance based on a custom container. This feature is available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. Only custom containers derived from the Google-provided base container are supported. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#1294-gke200">1.29.4-gke.200</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#1289-gke400">1.28.9-gke.400</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#12713-gke500">1.27.13-gke.500</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Database Migration Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Database Migration Service for heterogeneous Oracle migrations now features additional logging information that can help you better monitor the health and progress of your migration jobs. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-alloydb/logging">Logging for Oracle to AlloyDB</a>, and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-postgresql/logging">Logging for Oracle to Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Database Migration Service for heterogeneous Oracle migrations can now skip foreign keys and triggers, so dropping them from the destination database is no longer required. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-alloydb/configure-your-destination-postgresql-database#foreign-keys-triggers-considerations">Considerations for foreign keys and triggers for Oracle to AlloyDB</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-postgresql/configure-your-destination-postgresql-database#foreign-keys-triggers-considerations">Considerations for foreign keys and triggers for Oracle to Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now pin your event type selections for custom dashboards. Pinning saves your selections to the dashboard configuration, so they are applied when you reopen the dashboard. For more information, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/dashboards/show-events">Show events on a dashboard</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Storage</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Storage now offers a new pre-defined dual region, <code>EUROPE-WEST2</code> (London) and <code>EUROPE-WEST1</code> (Belgium). To learn more about Cloud Storage pre-defined dual regions, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/locations#predefined">Bucket locations page</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-version-clusters#supported_dataproc_versions">Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>2.0.105-debian10, 2.0.105-rocky8, 2.0.105-ubuntu18</li>\n<li>2.1.53-debian11, 2.1.53-rocky8, 2.1.53-ubuntu20, 2.1.53-ubuntu20-arm</li>\n<li>2.2.19-debian12, 2.2.19-rocky9, 2.2.19-ubuntu22</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Dataproc on Compute Engine:</strong> When creating a cluster with the latest Dataproc on Compute Engine image versions, the secondary worker <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/compute/dataproc-persistent-disks">boot disk</a> type now defaults to the primary worker boot disk type, which is <code>pd-standard</code> if the primary worker boot disk type is not specified.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_128600-gke163">Release 1.28.600-gke.163</h3>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.28.600-gke.163 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.28.600-gke.163 runs on Kubernetes 1.28.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">Ready storage partners</a> page to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Functionality changes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Updated preflight checks add a check for networking kernel modules (<code>ip_tables</code> or <code>np_tables</code>) and remove the <code>iptables</code> package check.</p></li>\n<li><p>Added checks to validate the SSH client certificate file type before saving the certificate as a Secret.</p></li>\n<li><p>Added support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.10 for Google Distributed Cloud software version 1.28.600-gke.163 and higher.</p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed an issue where the kubelet doesn\'t honor shortened, 1-second grace period for pod deletion during eviction-based draining.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following container image security vulnerabilities have been fixed in 1.28.600-gke.163: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>High-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39323">CVE-2023-39323</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-45285">CVE-2023-45285</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li><p>Medium-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39318">CVE-2023-39318</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-6780">CVE-2023-6780</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p><strong>Known issues:</strong></p>\n\n<p>For information about the latest known issues, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/troubleshooting/known-issues">Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues</a> in the Troubleshooting section.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r18_version_updates">(2024-R18) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. For more\ninformation on versioning and upgrades, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/versioning">GKE versioning and support</a>\nand <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/upgrades">Upgrades</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>No channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. Rollouts are already in progress\nwhen we publish the release notes, and can take multiple days to complete across all Google Cloud\nzones.</span></aside>\n<ul>\n<li>Version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1043002</a> is now the default version.</li>\n<li>The following versions are now available:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12615">1.26.15-gke.1390000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12615">1.26.15-gke.1390000</a></li>\n<li><a available:\n<ul>\n<li>1.26.15-gke.1300000</li>\n<li>1.26.15-gke.1372001</li>\n<li>1.27.11-gke.1062001</li>\n<li>1.27.12-gke.1115000</li>\n<li>1.28.8-gke.1095000</li>\n<li>1.29.1-gke.1589020</li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.26 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062004</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.27 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062004</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1043002</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n<section><h3>Stable channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. Rollouts are already in progress\nwhen we publish the release notes, and can take multiple days to complete across all Google Cloud\nzones.</span></aside>\n<ul>\n<li>Version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062004</a> is now the default version in the Stable channel.</li>\n<li>The following versions are now available in the Stable channel:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12713">1.27.13-gke.1000000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1289">1.28.9-gke.1000000</a></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>The following versions are no longer available in the Stable channel:\n<ul>\n<li>1.27.11-gke.1062003</li>\n<li>1.27.12-gke.1115000</li>\n<li>1.28.8-gke.1095000</li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.26 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062004</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.27 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062004</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n<section><h3>Regular channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. regions. For more information about all built-in infoTypes, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/infotypes-reference">InfoType detector reference</a>.</p>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos Attached Clusters</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>This release includes the following GKE attached clusters platform versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/attached/aks/reference/supported-versions#1290-gke2">1.29.0-gke.2</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/attached/aks/reference/supported-versions#1280-gke5">1.28.0-gke.5</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/attached/aks/reference/supported-versions#1270-gke8">1.27.0-gke.8</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos clusters on AWS</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#1294-gke200">1.29.4-gke.200</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#1289-gke400">1.28.9-gke.400</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/aws/reference/supported-versions#12713-gke500">1.27.13-gke.500</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos clusters on Azure</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#1294-gke200">1.29.4-gke.200</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#1289-gke400">1.28.9-gke.400</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/multi-cloud/docs/azure/reference/supported-versions#12713-gke500">1.27.13-gke.500</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Database Migration Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Database Migration Service for heterogeneous Oracle migrations now features additional logging information that can help you better monitor the health and progress of your migration jobs. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-alloydb/logging">Logging for Oracle to AlloyDB</a>, and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-postgresql/logging">Logging for Oracle to Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Database Migration Service for heterogeneous Oracle migrations can now skip foreign keys and triggers, so dropping them from the destination database is no longer required. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-alloydb/configure-your-destination-postgresql-database#foreign-keys-triggers-considerations">Considerations for foreign keys and triggers for Oracle to AlloyDB</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/database-migration/docs/oracle-to-postgresql/configure-your-destination-postgresql-database#foreign-keys-triggers-considerations">Considerations for foreign keys and triggers for Oracle to Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now pin your event type selections for custom dashboards. Pinning saves your selections to the dashboard configuration, so they are applied when you reopen the dashboard. For more information, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/dashboards/show-events">Show events on a dashboard</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Storage</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Storage now offers a new pre-defined dual region, <code>EUROPE-WEST2</code> (London) and <code>EUROPE-WEST1</code> (Belgium). To learn more about Cloud Storage pre-defined dual regions, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/locations#predefined">Bucket locations page</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-version-clusters#supported_dataproc_versions">Dataproc on Compute Engine subminor image versions</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>2.0.105-debian10, 2.0.105-rocky8, 2.0.105-ubuntu18</li>\n<li>2.1.53-debian11, 2.1.53-rocky8, 2.1.53-ubuntu20, 2.1.53-ubuntu20-arm</li>\n<li>2.2.19-debian12, 2.2.19-rocky9, 2.2.19-ubuntu22</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Dataproc on Compute Engine:</strong> When creating a cluster with the latest Dataproc on Compute Engine image versions, the secondary worker <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc/docs/concepts/compute/dataproc-persistent-disks">boot disk</a> type now defaults to the primary worker boot disk type, which is <code>pd-standard</code> if the primary worker boot disk type is not specified.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_128600-gke163">Release 1.28.600-gke.163</h3>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.28.600-gke.163 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.28.600-gke.163 runs on Kubernetes 1.28.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">Ready storage partners</a> page to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Functionality changes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Updated preflight checks add a check for networking kernel modules (<code>ip_tables</code> or <code>np_tables</code>) and remove the <code>iptables</code> package check.</p></li>\n<li><p>Added checks to validate the SSH client certificate file type before saving the certificate as a Secret.</p></li>\n<li><p>Added support for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.10 for Google Distributed Cloud software version 1.28.600-gke.163 and higher.</p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed an issue where the kubelet doesn\'t honor shortened, 1-second grace period for pod deletion during eviction-based draining.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following container image security vulnerabilities have been fixed in 1.28.600-gke.163: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>High-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39323">CVE-2023-39323</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-45285">CVE-2023-45285</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li><p>Medium-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39318">CVE-2023-39318</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39319">CVE-2023-39319</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-2961">CVE-2024-2961</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39326">CVE-2023-39326</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-28182">CVE-2024-28182</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li><p>Low-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-5363">CVE-2023-5363</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-6246">CVE-2023-6246</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-6779">CVE-2023-6779</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-6780">CVE-2023-6780</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p><strong>Known issues:</strong></p>\n\n<p>For information about the latest known issues, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/troubleshooting/known-issues">Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues</a> in the Troubleshooting section.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r18_version_updates">(2024-R18) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. For more\ninformation on versioning and upgrades, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/versioning">GKE versioning and support</a>\nand <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/upgrades">Upgrades</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>No channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. Rollouts are already in progress\nwhen we publish the release notes, and can take multiple days to complete across all Google Cloud\nzones.</span></aside>\n<ul>\n<li>Version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1043002</a> is now the default version.</li>\n<li>The following versions are now available:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12615">1.26.15-gke.1390000</a></li>\n<li><a available:\n<ul>\n<li>1.26.15-gke.1300000</li>\n<li>1.26.15-gke.1372001</li>\n<li>1.27.11-gke.1062001</li>\n<li>1.27.12-gke.1115000</li>\n<li>1.28.8-gke.1095000</li>\n<li>1.29.1-gke.1589020</li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.26 to version <a release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a To opt out, set the environment variable <code>ENABLE_EXTERNAL_NAME_ALIAS=false</code>.</p></li>\n</ol>\n\n<p>Note that opting out is only possible for in-cluster installations. You create bare metal instances using a new predefined machine type for the X4 memory-optimized machine series. X4 instances can be used to host the largest production SAP HANA databases. The Document AI Layout Parser transforms documents in various formats into structured representations. It makes content like paragraphs, tables, lists, and structural elements like headings, page headers, and footers easily accessible. It also creates context-aware chunks that facilitate information retrieval in a range of generative AI and discovery applications. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/document-ai/docs/layout-parse-chunk">Process documents with Layout Parser</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Media CDN</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>By default, Media CDN proxies only <code>GET</code>, <code>HEAD</code>, and <code>OPTIONS</code>\nmethods to your origin and filters out the methods that can modify your origin.\nIn <strong>Preview</strong>, you can <a href="https://cloud.google.com/media-cdn/docs/routing#method-filtering">override this default behavior for a specific route rule</a> by specifying other supported methods that you would like proxied to your origin. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Resource Manager</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Data Fusion supports annotating resources with tags in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. To opt out, set the environment variable to <code>VERIFY_CERT_AT_CLIENT=false</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>There are additional changes in <a href="https://istio.io/latest/news/releases/1.21.x/announcing-1.21/upgrade-notes/#externalname-support-changes">external name support</a>. To opt out, set the environment variable <code>ENABLE_EXTERNAL_NAME_ALIAS=false</code>.</p></li>\n</ol>\n\n<p>Note that opting out is only possible for in-cluster installations. If you do opt out, you must restore the default values before upgrading to 1.22.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p><strong>1.18.7-asm.26 is now available for in-cluster Cloud Service Mesh.</strong></p>\n\n<p>This patch release contains the fix for the security vulnerability listed in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-032">GCP-2024-032</a>. For details on upgrading Cloud Service Mesh, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/upgrade/upgrade">Upgrade Cloud Service Mesh</a>. Cloud Service Mesh v1.18.7-asm.26 uses Envoy v1.26.8.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p><strong>1.19.10-asm.6 is now available for in-cluster Cloud Service Mesh.</strong></p>\n\n<p>This patch release contains the fix for the security vulnerability listed in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-032">GCP-2024-032</a>. For details on upgrading Cloud Service Mesh, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/upgrade/upgrade">Upgrade Cloud Service Mesh</a>. Cloud Service Mesh v1.19.10-asm.6 uses Envoy v1.27.6.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p><strong>1.20.7-asm.2 is now available for in-cluster Cloud Service Mesh.</strong></p>\n\n<p>This patch release contains the fix for the security vulnerability listed in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-032">GCP-2024-032</a>. For details on upgrading Cloud Service Mesh, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/service-mesh/docs/upgrade/upgrade">Upgrade Cloud Service Mesh</a>. Cloud Service Mesh v1.20.7-asm.2 uses Envoy v1.28.4.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now order and request quota for X4 bare metal instances. You create bare metal instances using a new predefined machine type for the X4 memory-optimized machine series. X4 instances can be used to host the largest production SAP HANA databases. For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/memory-optimized-machines#x4_series">X4 machine series</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Config Connector</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Config Connector version 1.118.2 is now available.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><code>LoggingLogMetric</code></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Change <code>.spec.projectRef.kind</code> from required to be optional. </li>\n<li>If this field is given, it has to be <code>.spec.projectRef.kind: Project</code>. </li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Iceberg read/write support is available through the new Managed I/O Java API. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/managed-io">Dataflow managed I/O</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Document AI</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Layout Parser in Document AI is generally available. The Document AI Layout Parser transforms documents in various formats into structured representations. It makes content like paragraphs, tables, lists, and structural elements like headings, page headers, and footers easily accessible. It also creates context-aware chunks that facilitate information retrieval in a range of generative AI and discovery applications. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/document-ai/docs/layout-parse-chunk">Process documents with Layout Parser</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Media CDN</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>By default, Media CDN proxies only <code>GET</code>, <code>HEAD</code>, and <code>OPTIONS</code>\nmethods to your origin and filters out the methods that can modify your origin.\nIn <strong>Preview</strong>, you can <a href="https://cloud.google.com/media-cdn/docs/routing#method-filtering">override this default behavior for a specific route rule</a> by specifying other supported methods that you would like proxied to your origin. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Resource Manager</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Data Fusion supports annotating resources with tags in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.16.9-gke.40  is now available for\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/on-prem/latest/downloads">download</a>.\nTo upgrade, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/on-prem/latest/how-to/upgrading">Upgrade a cluster or a node pool</a>.\nGoogle Distributed Cloud 1.16.9-gke.40 runs on Kubernetes  v1.27.13-gke.500.  </p>\n\n<p>If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">GDCV Ready storage partners</a>\ndocument to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release. </p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following vulnerabilities are fixed in 1.16.9-gke.40:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Container-optimized OS vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-26907">CVE-2024-26907</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-18342">CVE-2017-18342</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a class="external" href="https://github.com/googleapis/python-pubsub/commit/086dd4660ec56d9ff2d41a32ec0b8e8dc44acc55" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">086dd46</a>)</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">SAP on Google Cloud</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>New SAP certifications: X4 series of memory-optimized bare metal machine types</strong></p>\n\n<p>For use with SAP HANA scale-up (OLAP and OLTP) and SAP NetWeaver workloads, SAP has certified the following Compute Engine memory-optimized bare metal machine types: <code>x4-megamem-1440-metal</code> and <code>x4-megamem-1920-metal</code>.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/solutions/sap/docs/sap-hana-planning-guide#bare-metal-machines-for-hana">Bare metal machine types for SAP HANA</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/solutions/sap/docs/certifications-sap-apps#sap-certified-vms">Certified machine types for SAP applications</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/memory-optimized-machines#x4_series">X4 machine series</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Security Command Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service released to General Availability</strong></p>\n\n<p>The Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service, a built-in service of the Enterprise tier of Security Command Center, is released to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">General Availability</a>.</p>\n\n<p>The Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service creates a disk snapshot to assess Amazon Web Service EC2 machines for software vulnerabilities.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/vulnerability-assessment-aws-overview">Overview of Vulnerability Assessment for AWS</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Spanner</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/query-optimizer/versions#version-7">Query Optimizer version 7</a> is generally available. Version 6 remains the default optimizer version.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Workbench</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/workforce-identity-federation">Workforce Identity Federation</a> with Vertex AI Workbench instances in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. Workforce Identity Federation lets you create and manage Vertex AI Workbench instances with credentials provided by an external identity provider (IdP).\nFor more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/workbench/instances/create-third-party-instance">Create an instance with third party credentials</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Virtual Private Cloud</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Support for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/routes#static-route-next-hops">IPv6 static routes</a> with a next hop instance identified by address (<code>next-hop-address</code>) is available in <strong>Preview</strong>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Bring your own IP lets you <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/bring-your-own-ip#comparison">bring your own public IPv6 addresses</a> to Google Cloud. IPv6 BYOIP addresses can be used with <a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/network/setting-up-network-backend-service#byoip-ipv6">external passthrough Network Load Balancers</a>. Bring your own IP for IPv6 addresses is available in <strong>General Availability</strong>.</p>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Agent Assist</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Agent Assist now offers a native UI Connector with Genesys Cloud to integrate with Chat conversations. See the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/agent-assist/agent-assist/docs/genesys">documentation</a> for details.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Agent Assist now offers a native UI Connector with Twilio Flex to integrate with chat conversations. See the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/agent-assist/agent-assist/docs/twilio">documentation</a> for details. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Backup for GKE</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup for GKE introduces new policies for handling namespaced resources conflict during restoration that are compatible with GitOps tools. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/how-to/resource-conflict">Handle resource conflicts during restore</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup for GKE now supports specifying the restore order when you create or update a restore plan. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/how-to/restore-order">Specify resource restore ordering during restoration</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup for GKE now allows configuration of volume data restore policies bound to specific volume types and overridden for specific volumes. This gives you more flexibility when restoring volumes. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/how-to/volume-data-restore-policy">Define volume data restore behavior</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Starting June 24, 2024, Backup for GKE will gradually roll out the Backup-Side Restore Validation feature to help ensure that backups are restorable. This change applies to backups under backup plans created from June 24, 2024 onwards. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/troubleshoot/permissive-mode">Enable permissive mode on a backup plan</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup for GKE now provides enhanced granularity in resource selection during the restore creation process. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/how-to/fine-grained-restore">Enable fine-grained restore</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for VMware 1.16.9-gke.40  is now available for\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/on-prem/latest/downloads">download</a>.\nTo upgrade, see\n<a  </p>\n\n<p>If you are using a third-party storage vendor, check the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">GDCV Ready storage partners</a>\ndocument to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release. </p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following vulnerabilities are fixed in 1.16.9-gke.40:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Container-optimized OS target="_blank">086dd46</a>)</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">SAP on Google Cloud</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>New SAP certifications: X4 series of memory-optimized bare metal machine types</strong></p>\n\n<p>For use with SAP HANA scale-up (OLAP and OLTP) and SAP NetWeaver workloads, SAP has certified the following Compute Engine memory-optimized bare metal machine types: <code>x4-megamem-1440-metal</code> and <code>x4-megamem-1920-metal</code>.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/solutions/sap/docs/sap-hana-planning-guide#bare-metal-machines-for-hana">Bare metal machine types for SAP HANA</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/solutions/sap/docs/certifications-sap-apps#sap-certified-vms">Certified machine types for SAP applications</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/memory-optimized-machines#x4_series">X4 machine series</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Security Command Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service released to General Availability</strong></p>\n\n<p>The Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service, a built-in service of the Enterprise tier of Security Command Center, is released to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">General Availability</a>.</p>\n\n<p>The Vulnerability Assessment for AWS service creates a disk snapshot to assess Amazon Web Service EC2 machines for software vulnerabilities.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/vulnerability-assessment-aws-overview">Overview of Vulnerability Assessment for AWS</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Spanner</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/query-optimizer/versions#version-7">Query Optimizer version 7</a> is generally available. Version 6 remains the default optimizer version.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Workbench</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/iam/docs/workforce-identity-federation">Workforce Identity Federation</a> with Vertex AI Workbench instances in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. Workforce Identity Federation lets you create and manage Vertex AI Workbench instances with credentials provided by an external identity provider (IdP).\nFor more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/workbench/instances/create-third-party-instance">Create an instance with third party credentials</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Virtual Private Cloud</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Support for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/routes#static-route-next-hops">IPv6 static routes</a> with a next hop instance identified by address (<code>next-hop-address</code>) is available in <strong>Preview</strong>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Bring your own IP lets you <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/docs/bring-your-own-ip#comparison">bring your own public IPv6 addresses</a> to Google Cloud. IPv6 BYOIP addresses can be used with <a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/network/setting-up-network-backend-service#byoip-ipv6">external passthrough Network Load Balancers</a>. portal.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>This release includes the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">general availability (GA)</a> of integrated portal APIs which allow you to manage your integrated portal APIs and reference documentation using API calls. The available functionality has not changed since the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/portal/release-notes#November_10_2023">public preview release</a>.</p>\n\n<p>The catalog items list view now uses pagination when making requests to the portals service, examples have been added to <strong>Publishing your APIs</strong>, and new reference documentation is available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/portal/publish-apis">Publishing your APIs</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.sites.apicategories">API categories reference documentation</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.sites.apidocs">API documents reference documentation</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/conditions">IAM conditions</a> to control access to BigQuery resources. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Asset Inventory</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following resource types are now publicly available through the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/analyzing-iam-policy">Analyze IAM Policies APIs</a> (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/analyzeIamPolicy">AnalyzeIamPolicy</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/analyzeIamPolicyLongrunning">AnalyzeIamPolicyLongrunning</a>).</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Cloud Config Manager API\n<ul>\n<li><code>config.googleapis.com/Deployment</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Cloud Monitoring\n<ul>\n<li><code>monitoring.googleapis.com/NotificationChannel</code></li>\n<li><code>monitoring.googleapis.com/Snooze</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud SQL for SQL Server</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud SQL for SQL Server now supports storage of <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/sqlserver/backup-recovery/restore#tips-pitr">point-in-time recovery (PITR)</a> transaction logs in Cloud Storage.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p>Creating a larger (&gt;90 vCPUs) C3D <code>standard-lssd</code> or <code>highmem-lssd</code> VM results in an error message. See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/troubleshooting/known-issues">Known issues</a> for the workaround. Larger C3D VMs that don\'t require <code>-lssd</code> are not impacted.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/using-cloud-monitoring#metrics-explorer">use Metrics Explorer</a> to find individual DoFns that cause latencies in streaming jobs. These metrics are available in streaming pipelines that use Apache Beam 2.53.0 and later versions. The following new metrics are available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Average message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_average</code>)</li>\n<li>Maximum message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_max</code>)</li>\n<li>Minimum message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_min</code>)</li>\n<li>Number of messages processed per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_num_messages</code>)</li>\n<li>Oldest active message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/oldest_active_message_age</code>)</li>\n<li>Total message processing time per DoFn  (<code>job/dofn_latency_total</code>)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information about Dataflow metrics, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp#gcp-dataflow">Google Cloud metrics</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Generative AI on Vertex AI</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Generative AI on Vertex AI Regional APIs</strong></p>\n\n<p>New Generative AI on Vertex AI regional APIs are available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/locations#available-regions">three additional locations</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Anthropic Claude 3.0 Opus model</strong></p>\n\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/partner-models/use-claude#claude-opus">Anthropic Claude 3.0 Opus</a> model is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Generally Available</a>. To learn more, see its <a href="https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/anthropic/model-garden/claude-3-opus">model card in Model Garden</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Security Command Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>VM Threat Detection\'s malware detector released to General Availability</strong></p>\n\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/concepts-vm-threat-detection-overview">Virtual Machine Threat Detection</a>, a built-in service of Security Command Center, launched the <code>Malware: Malicious file on disk (YARA)</code> detector to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>. This detector generates a finding if an executable file in a virtual machine matches known malware signatures.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Spanner</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Spanner now supports the protocol buffer data type in GoogleSQL. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/reference/standard-sql/protocol-buffers">Work with protocol buffers in GoogleSQL</a>.</p>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A monthly digest of client library updates from across the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sdk">Cloud SDK</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>Go</h3><h3 class="external" id="changes_for_spanneradmindatabaseapiv1" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">Changes for <a href="https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-go/tree/main/spanner/admin/database/apiv1">spanner/admin/database/apiv1</a></h3>\n\n<h4 id="1610_2024-04-30"><a class="external" href="https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-go/compare/spanner/v1.60.0...spanner/v1.61.0" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">1.61.0</a> (2024-04-30)</h4>\n\n<h5 id="features">Features</h5>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>spanner/admin/instance:</strong> Adding <code>EXPECTED_FULFILLMENT_PERIOD</code> to the indicate instance creation times (with <code>FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_NORMAL</code> or <code>FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_EXTENDED</code> ENUM) with the extended instance creation time triggered by On-Demand Capacity... href="https://github.com/googleapis/python-spanner/compare/v3.45.0...v3.46.0" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">3.46.0</a> (2024-05-02)</h4>\n\n<h5 id="features_7">Features</h5>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>spanner:</strong> Adding EXPECTED_FULFILLMENT_PERIOD to the indicate instance creation times (with FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_NORMAL or FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_EXTENDED ENUM) with the extended instance creation time triggered by On-Demand Capacity Feature (<a class="external" href="https://github.com/googleapis/python-spanner/commit/293ecdad78b51f248f8d5c023bdba3bac998ea5c" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">293ecda</a>)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<h5 target="_blank">1164743</a>)</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Model Monitoring v2 is in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>, which centralizes model monitoring configuration and visualization on a model version and enables monitoring models being served outside of Vertex AI. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/model-monitoring/overview">Vertex AI Model Monitoring overview</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Agent Builder</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Vertex AI Search: Document ranking API (GA)</strong></p>\n\n<p>The ranking API takes a list of documents and reranks those documents based on how relevant the documents are to a query. This is a stateless API that does not require you to index documents in advance.</p>\n\n<p>The ranking API is Generally available (GA).</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/generative-ai-app-builder/docs/ranking">Rank and rerank documents</a>. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Workflows</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Support for the following connectors is generally available (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>):</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/ml/Overview.md">AI platform training and prediction</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/integrations/Overview">Application Integration</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/batch/Overview">Batch API</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/bigquerydatatransfer/Overview.md">BigQuery Data Transfer</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/cloudresourcemanager/Overview.md">Cloud Resource Manager</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/forms/Overview">Google Forms</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/sheets/Overview">Google Sheets</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/workflows/docs/reference/googleapis/transcoder/Overview">Transcoder API</a></li>\n</ul>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee Integrated Portal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 31, 2024 we released an updated version of Apigee integrated portal.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>This release includes the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">general availability (GA)</a> of integrated portal APIs which allow you to manage your integrated portal APIs and reference documentation using API calls. The available functionality has not changed since the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/portal/release-notes#November_10_2023">public preview release</a>.</p>\n\n<p>The catalog items list view now uses pagination when making requests to the portals service, examples have been added to <strong>Publishing your APIs</strong>, and new reference documentation is available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/portal/publish-apis">Publishing your APIs</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.sites.apicategories">API categories reference documentation</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/reference/apis/apigee/rest/v1/organizations.sites.apidocs">API documents reference documentation</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/conditions">IAM conditions</a> to control access to BigQuery resources. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Asset Inventory</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following resource types are now publicly available through the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/analyzing-iam-policy">Analyze IAM Policies APIs</a> (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/analyzeIamPolicy">AnalyzeIamPolicy</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/analyzeIamPolicyLongrunning">AnalyzeIamPolicyLongrunning</a>).</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Cloud Config Manager API\n<ul>\n<li><code>config.googleapis.com/Deployment</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Cloud Monitoring\n<ul>\n<li><code>monitoring.googleapis.com/NotificationChannel</code></li>\n<li><code>monitoring.googleapis.com/Snooze</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud SQL for SQL Server</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud SQL for SQL Server now supports storage of <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/sqlserver/backup-recovery/restore#tips-pitr">point-in-time recovery (PITR)</a> transaction logs in Cloud Storage.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p>Creating a larger (&gt;90 vCPUs) C3D <code>standard-lssd</code> or <code>highmem-lssd</code> VM results in an error message. See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/troubleshooting/known-issues">Known issues</a> for the workaround. Larger C3D VMs that don\'t require <code>-lssd</code> are not impacted.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/guides/using-cloud-monitoring#metrics-explorer">use Metrics Explorer</a> to find individual DoFns that cause latencies in streaming jobs. These metrics are available in streaming pipelines that use Apache Beam 2.53.0 and later versions. The following new metrics are available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Average message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_average</code>)</li>\n<li>Maximum message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_max</code>)</li>\n<li>Minimum message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_min</code>)</li>\n<li>Number of messages processed per DoFn (<code>job/dofn_latency_num_messages</code>)</li>\n<li>Oldest active message processing time per DoFn (<code>job/oldest_active_message_age</code>)</li>\n<li>Total message processing time per DoFn  (<code>job/dofn_latency_total</code>)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information about Dataflow metrics, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/metrics_gcp#gcp-dataflow">Google Cloud metrics</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Generative AI on Vertex AI</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Generative AI on Vertex AI Regional APIs</strong></p>\n\n<p>New Generative AI on Vertex AI regional APIs are available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/locations#available-regions">three additional locations</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Anthropic Claude 3.0 Opus model</strong></p>\n\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/partner-models/use-claude#claude-opus">Anthropic Claude 3.0 Opus</a> model is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Generally Available</a>. To learn more, see its <a href="https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/publishers/anthropic/model-garden/claude-3-opus">model card in Model Garden</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Security Command Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>VM Threat Detection\'s malware detector released to General Availability</strong></p>\n\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/security-command-center/docs/concepts-vm-threat-detection-overview">Virtual Machine Threat Detection</a>, a built-in service of Security Command Center, launched the <code>Malware: Malicious file on disk (YARA)</code> detector to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>. This detector generates a finding if an executable file in a virtual machine matches known malware signatures.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Spanner</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Spanner now supports the protocol buffer data type in GoogleSQL. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/spanner/docs/reference/standard-sql/protocol-buffers">Work with protocol buffers in GoogleSQL</a>.</p>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A monthly digest of client library updates from across the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sdk">Cloud SDK</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>Go</h3><h3 class="external" id="changes_for_spanneradmindatabaseapiv1" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">Changes for <a href="https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-go/tree/main/spanner/admin/database/apiv1">spanner/admin/database/apiv1</a></h3>\n\n<h4 id="1610_2024-04-30"><a class="external" href="https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-go/compare/spanner/v1.60.0...spanner/v1.61.0" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">1.61.0</a> (2024-04-30)</h4>\n\n<h5 id="features">Features</h5>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>spanner/admin/instance:</strong> Adding <code>EXPECTED_FULFILLMENT_PERIOD</code> to the indicate instance creation times (with <code>FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_NORMAL</code> or <code>FULFILLMENT_PERIOD_EXTENDED</code> ENUM) with the extended instance creation time triggered by On-Demand Capacity... served outside of Vertex AI. This is a stateless API that does not require you to index documents in advance.</p>\n\n<p>The ranking API is Generally available (GA).</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a data source.</p>\n\n<p><a href="https://support.google.com/looker-studio/answer/12388266#lookml-filters">Learn more about LookML filters for Looker data sources</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">NetApp Volumes</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The Standard in Preview service level is now called Flex and is generally available. You can now use the Flex service level in additional regions. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/netapp/volumes/docs/discover/overview#key_features">NetApp Volumes key features</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The volume replication feature for the Flex service level is now generally available. You might not be able to use the functionality until the rollout is complete.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Preview release of Shadow API Discovery</strong></p>\n\n<p>This release introduces Shadow API Discovery in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">preview</a>. Shadow API Discovery finds shadow APIs (also known as undocumented or unmanaged APIs) in your existing cloud infrastructure. Shadow APIs pose a security risk to your system, since they might be unsecured, unmonitored, and unmaintained. </p>\n\n<p>For a feature overview and usage information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-observation/shadow-api-discovery">Shadow API Discovery</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee X</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 29, 2024 we released an updated version of Apigee</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong><a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">Preview</a> release of API Management features in Gemini Code Assist: generative AI API spec creation with enterprise context and Apigee policy code explanation. This release also includes the preview release of enhanced API hub interaction in Cloud Code.</strong></p>\n\n<p>This release introduces features for Gemini Code Assist API management: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Use Gemini Code Assist to facilitate API design including OpenAPI spec generation with enterprise context from natural language prompts and built in visual API designer to further refine the specification.</li>\n<li>Code explain for Apigee policies: When adding or editing a proxy policy, highlight part of the policy XML code, such as an element or attribute, to see Gemini Assist-generated information and guidance about the selection.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information and usage instructions, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/get-started/gemini-code-assist">Use Gemini Code Assist</a>.</p>\n\n<p>This release also includes updates to API hub interaction from Cloud Code: An update to the Cloud Code extension enables you to interact with any API in your API hub using a mock server in Cloud Code, make changes to the API, and publish it back to API hub. For information and usage instructions, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/local-development/vscode/develop-design-edit-apis#edit-apis">Edit APIs</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/quotas#partitioned_tables">maximum number of partitions per partitioned table</a> limit has changed from 4,000 to 10,000.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Logging</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Ops Agent version 2.47.0 introduces support for Compute Engine VMs that are running Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat). For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/solutions/agents/ops-agent#supported_operating_systems">Operating systems</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Ops Agent version 2.47.0 introduces support for Compute Engine VMs that are running Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (Noble Numbat). For more information about extended support, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/mysql/extended-support">Extended support for Cloud SQL</a>.</p>\n\n<p>For more information about extended support timelines, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/mysql/db-versions">Database versions and version policies</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Cloud SQL for PostgreSQL major versions that have reached community end-of-life (EOL) will receive extended support starting on February 1, 2025. class="release-note-product-title">Dataform</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Dataform Core <code>includeDependentAssertions</code> and <code>dependOnDependencyAssertions</code> parameters for adding assertions as dependencies are available.</p>\n\n<p>You can set the <code>includeDependentAssertions</code> parameter in a selected action to automatically add assertions of a selected dependency action as dependencies of the edited action. </p>\n\n<p>You can set <code>dependOnDependencyAssertions</code> the parameter in a selected action to automatically add assertions of all dependency actions as dependencies of the edited action. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataform/docs/assertions#add_assertions_as_dependencies">Set assertions as dependencies</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dialogflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Dialogflow CX</strong>: You can now integrate with <a If your hybrid installation is currently on Apigee hybrid v1.12.0, you can install this hotfix release by downloading the charts with the version tag <code>1.12.0-hotfix.1</code> and updating the <code>apigee-operator</code> and <code>apigee-datastore</code> charts with the <code>helm upgrade</code> command and your current overrides files. </p>\n\n<p>For example: </p>\n<pre class="prettyprint"><code>export CHART_REPO=oci://us-docker.pkg.dev/apigee-release/apigee-hybrid-helm-charts\nexport CHART_VERSION=1.12.0-hotfix.1\nhelm pull $CHART_REPO/apigee-operator --version $CHART_VERSION --untar\nhelm pull $CHART_REPO/apigee-datastore --version $CHART_VERSION --untar\n</code></pre><pre class="prettyprint"><code>helm upgrade operator apigee-operator/ \\\n  --namespace apigee-system \\\n  --atomic \\\n  -f overrides.yaml \n\nhelm upgrade datastore apigee-datastore/ \\\n  --namespace apigee \\\n  --atomic \\\n  -f overrides.yaml\n</code></pre>\n<ul>\n<li>For information on upgrading, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/hybrid/v1.12/upgrade">Upgrading Apigee hybrid to version 1.12.0-hotfix.1</a>. </li>\n<li>For information on new installations, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/hybrid/v1.12/big-picture">The big picture</a>. </li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<table>\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th>Bug ID</th>\n<th>Description</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>340889560</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Added <code>csi</code> to the <code>apigee-logger</code> SCC.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>339849002</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Hashicorp Vault integration issues fixed for Google Service Account for Cassandra Backup/Restore.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bare Metal Solution</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/order-bms-resources">order Bare Metal Solution storage and Partner Interconnect resources</a> on a 1 month commitment term. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following Generative AI features are now in\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">preview</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Creating\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model">remote models</a>\nbased on the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/models#gemini-models">Vertex AI gemini-1.5-flash foundation model</a>.</li>\n<li>Using the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text"><code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>\nwith these remote models to perform generative natural language tasks for\ntext stored in BigQuery tables.</li>\n<li>Using the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text"><code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>\nwith these remote models to perform generative AI tasks, for example audio\ntranscription or document classification, using image, video, audio, PDF,\nor text content stored in BigQuery\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/object-table-introduction">object tables</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Try these features with the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/generate-text">Generate text by using the <code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>\nhow-to topic.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Announcing new Open Telemetry samples that show how to instrument your Python and Node.js applications to collect metrics, logs, and traces:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/setup/python">Python example</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/setup/nodejs">Node.js example</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For general instrumentation information and recommendations, and for links to other samples, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/overview">Instrumentation and observability overview</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/choose-approach">Choose an instrumentation approach</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Trace</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now search a trace for keywords. For more information, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/trace/docs/finding-traces#search-trace">Search a trace</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Announcing new Open Telemetry samples that show how to instrument your Python and Node.js applications to collect metrics, logs, and traces:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/setup/python">Python example</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/setup/nodejs">Node.js example</a></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For general instrumentation information and recommendations, and for links to other samples, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/overview">Instrumentation and observability overview</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/stackdriver/docs/instrumentation/choose-approach">Choose an instrumentation approach</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Translation</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>For <a href="https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/adaptive-translation#api">adaptive translations</a>, when you use the API, you can include up to five reference sentence pairs in a request instead of specifying a dataset.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Workstations</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/workstations/docs/preconfigured-base-images">Code-OSS preconfigured base image</a> uses version 1.89.1.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Contact Center AI Platform</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>Version 3.16 is released</strong></p>\n\n<p>All release notes published on this date are part of version 3.16.</p>\n\n<p>The timing of the update to your instance depends on the deployment schedule that  you have chosen. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/contact-center/ccai-platform/docs/deployment-schedules">Deployment schedules</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>End co-browse sessions using the Apps API</strong></p>\n\n<p>The Apps API has the following new endpoint that lets you end a co-browse session using an external session ID: <code>POST /apps/api/v1/cobrowse_sessions/{external_session_id}/end</code>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/contact-center/ccai-platform/docs/Apps-API/publication#cobrowse">Co-browse</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>The agent adapter generates co-browse events</strong></p>\n\n<p>The agent adapter generates events during co-browse sessions. You can use these events to get insights into co-browse session details, such as start and end times and the modes that are requested or accepted by the end-user. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/contact-center/ccai-platform/docs/Custom_CRM#event-types">Event types</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>The Next UI is supported in the ServiceNow integration</strong></p>\n\n<p>The Next UI experience is supported in the ServiceNow CRM integration.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed an issue that prevented agents from selecting their next status to exit a campaign when the current call is concluded.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed the problem of the <code>created_at</code> field being missing from <code>add_started_activity</code>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Optimized OS</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h3 id="cos-105-17412-370-39_">cos-105-17412-370-39 <a id="cos-arm64-105-17412-370-39"></h3>\n\n<table class="pkg">\n  <tr>\n    <td>Kernel</td>\n    <td>Docker</td>\n    <td>Containerd</td>\n    <td>GPU Drivers</td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n    <td><a href="https://cos.googlesource.com/third_party/kernel/+/437908069a4654010705ea35f6983e7ba8061603">COS-5.15.154</a></td>\n    <td>v23.0.3</td>\n    <td>v1.7.15</td>\n    <td>v470.239.06(default),v550.54.15(latest)</td>\n  </tr>\n</table>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Improved boot time on A3 machines by around 5 seconds.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed system-accounts-secured benchmark by changing the system account range used in the benchmark.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2024-21626 in github.com/opencontainers/runc in kubelet.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Updated dev-vcs/git to v2.45.1. This fixes CVE-2024-28834.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataplex</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Dataplex automatic data quality supports the following capabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Email notifications to alert people about the status and\nresults of a data quality job</li>\n<li>Data quality scores that indicate the percentage of\nrules that passed</li>\n<li>API support for rule recommendations based on data profiling scans</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/use-auto-data-quality">Use auto data quality</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/auto-data-quality-overview">Auto data quality overview</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Document AI</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Model <code>pretrained-foundation-model-v1.2-2024-05-10</code> is available for custom extractor. For more information about available models, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/document-ai/docs/ce-with-genai#models">Custom extractor model versions</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Architecture Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>(New guide) <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution">Build an ML vision analytics solution with Dataflow and Cloud Vision API</a>: Deploy a Dataflow pipeline to process large-scale image files with Cloud Vision. Dataflow stores the results in BigQuery so that you can use them to train BigQuery ML pre-built models. This architecture is accompanied by a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution">reference architecture</a> and a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution/deployment">deployment guide</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_1169">Release 1.16.9</h3>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.16.9 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.16.9 runs on Kubernetes 1.27.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">Ready storage partners</a> document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud software.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><strong>Fixes:</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following container image security vulnerabilities have been fixed in 1.16.9: latest known issues, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/troubleshooting/known-issues">Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues</a> in the Troubleshooting section.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<h3 id="security_bulletin_all_minor_versions">Security bulletin (all minor versions)</h3>\n\n<p>A new vulnerability (<a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-4323">CVE-2024-4323</a>) has been discovered in Fluent Bit that could result in remote code execution. Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 through 3.0.3 are affected.</p>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud software doesn\'t use a vulnerable version of Fluent Bit and is unaffected.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-031">GCP-2024-031</a> security bulletin.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A new vulnerability (CVE-2024-4323) has been discovered in Fluent Bit that could result in remote code execution. Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 through 3.0.3 are affected.</p>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud doesn\'t use a vulnerable version of Fluent Bit and is unaffected.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Rapid channel will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a If your hybrid installation is currently on Apigee hybrid v1.12.0, you can install this hotfix release by downloading the charts with the version tag <code>1.12.0-hotfix.1</code> and updating the <code>apigee-operator</code> and <code>apigee-datastore</code> charts with the <code>helm upgrade</code> command and your current overrides files. </p>\n\n<p>For example: </p>\n<pre class="prettyprint"><code>export CHART_REPO=oci://us-docker.pkg.dev/apigee-release/apigee-hybrid-helm-charts\nexport CHART_VERSION=1.12.0-hotfix.1\nhelm pull $CHART_REPO/apigee-operator --version $CHART_VERSION --untar\nhelm pull $CHART_REPO/apigee-datastore --version $CHART_VERSION --untar\n</code></pre><pre class="prettyprint"><code>helm upgrade operator apigee-operator/ \\\n  --namespace apigee-system \\\n  --atomic \\\n  -f overrides.yaml \n\nhelm upgrade datastore apigee-datastore/ \\\n  --namespace apigee \\\n  --atomic \\\n  -f overrides.yaml\n</code></pre>\n<ul>\n<li>For information on upgrading, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/hybrid/v1.12/upgrade">Upgrading Apigee hybrid to version 1.12.0-hotfix.1</a>. </li>\n<li>For information on new installations, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/hybrid/v1.12/big-picture">The big picture</a>. </li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<table>\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th>Bug ID</th>\n<th>Description</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>340889560</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Added <code>csi</code> to the <code>apigee-logger</code> SCC.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>339849002</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Hashicorp Vault integration issues fixed for Google Service Account for Cassandra Backup/Restore.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bare Metal Solution</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/order-bms-resources">order Bare Metal Solution storage and Partner Interconnect resources</a> on a 1 month commitment term. language tasks for\ntext stored in BigQuery tables.</li>\n<li>Using the\n<a You can use these events to get insights into co-browse session details, such as start and end times and the modes that are requested or accepted by the end-user.
