This resolves CVE-2016-1585.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Updated net-libs/gnutls to v3.8.5. This fixes CVE-2024-28834.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataplex</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Dataplex automatic data quality supports the following capabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Email notifications to alert people about the status and\nresults of a data quality job</li>\n<li>Data quality scores that indicate the percentage of\nrules that passed</li>\n<li>API support for rule recommendations based on data profiling scans</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/use-auto-data-quality">Use auto data quality</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataplex/docs/auto-data-quality-overview">Auto data quality overview</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Document AI</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Model <code>pretrained-foundation-model-v1.2-2024-05-10</code> is available for custom extractor. For more information about available models, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/document-ai/docs/ce-with-genai#models">Custom extractor model versions</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Architecture Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>(New guide) <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution">Build an ML vision analytics solution with Dataflow and Cloud Vision API</a>: Deploy a Dataflow pipeline to process large-scale image files with Cloud Vision. Dataflow stores the results in BigQuery so that you can use them to train BigQuery ML pre-built models. This architecture is accompanied by a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution">reference architecture</a> and a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/building-a-vision-analytics-solution/deployment">deployment guide</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_1169">Release 1.16.9</h3>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.16.9 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal 1.16.9 runs on Kubernetes 1.27.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">Ready storage partners</a> document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of Google Distributed Cloud software.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><strong>Fixes:</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following container image security vulnerabilities have been fixed in 1.16.9: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>High-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39323">CVE-2023-39323</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-45285">CVE-2023-45285</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li><p>Medium-severity container vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39318">CVE-2023-39318</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39319">CVE-2023-39319</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-2961">CVE-2024-2961</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-39326">CVE-2023-39326</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-5363">CVE-2023-5363</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2023-6780">CVE-2023-6780</a></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p><strong>Known issues:</strong></p>\n\n<p>For information about the latest known issues, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/troubleshooting/known-issues">Google Distributed Cloud for bare metal known issues</a> in the Troubleshooting section.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<h3 id="security_bulletin_all_minor_versions">Security bulletin (all minor versions)</h3>\n\n<p>A new vulnerability (<a href="https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-4323">CVE-2024-4323</a>) has been discovered in Fluent Bit that could result in remote code execution. Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 through 3.0.3 are affected.</p>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud software doesn\'t use a vulnerable version of Fluent Bit and is unaffected.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-031">GCP-2024-031</a> security bulletin.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A new vulnerability (CVE-2024-4323) has been discovered in Fluent Bit that could result in remote code execution. Fluent Bit versions 2.0.7 through 3.0.3 are affected.</p>\n\n<p>Google Distributed Cloud doesn\'t use a vulnerable version of Fluent Bit and is unaffected.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. For more\ninformation on versioning and upgrades, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/versioning">GKE versioning and support</a>\nand <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/upgrades">Upgrades</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>No channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. preview. Hybrid search uses both dense and sparse embeddings, which lets you search based on a combination of keyword search and semantic search. The release fixes an issue in the Decompress plugin causing concatenated GZIP files (<code>.gz</code>) to not decompress as intended. In version 1.2.1, decompression occurs until EOF is reached (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1743">PLUGIN-1743</a>).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Storage</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Storage FUSE now offers the following features: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>You now have the option to disable authentication on custom endpoints using the <code>--anonymous-access</code> flag. For more information about the new global option, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/gcsfuse-cli">Cloud Storage FUSE CLI options page</a>.</li>\n<li>GCS FUSE now supports Rocky Linux versions 8.9 or later. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/gcsfuse-install#configure-package-manager">Cloud Storage FUSE instructions on how to configure the package manager</a>.</li>\n<li>The GCS FUSE <code>max-conns-per-host</code> flag has been updated to offer a default value which specifies no limit on TCP connections except for limitations set by your machine\'s specifications. <a href="https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/concepts/versioning/composer-versions">images</a> are available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>composer-2.8.1-airflow-2.7.3 (default)</li>\n<li>composer-2.8.1-airflow-2.6.3</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Data Fusion</h2>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The Decompress plugin version 1.2.1 is available in the Hub in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1 and later. The release fixes an issue in the Decompress plugin causing concatenated GZIP files (<code>.gz</code>) to not decompress as intended. In version 1.2.1, decompression occurs until EOF is reached (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1743">PLUGIN-1743</a>).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Storage</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Storage FUSE now offers the following features: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>You now have the option to disable authentication on custom endpoints using the <code>--anonymous-access</code> flag. For more information about the new global option, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/gcsfuse-cli">Cloud Storage FUSE CLI options page</a>.</li>\n<li>GCS FUSE now supports Rocky Linux versions 8.9 or later. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/gcsfuse-install#configure-package-manager">Cloud Storage FUSE instructions on how to configure the package manager</a>.</li>\n<li>The GCS FUSE <code>max-conns-per-host</code> flag has been updated to offer a default value which specifies no limit on TCP connections except for limitations set by your machine\'s specifications. For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/gcsfuse-cli">GCS FUSE CLI page</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A weekly digest of client library updates from You can now enable this feature by using the Google Cloud Console in addition to the gcloud SDK and REST API. When this feature is enabled, Media CDN uses a short-duration token and a long-duration token to authenticate requests.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can use the globally scoped edge security policies of Cloud Armor for Layer 7 filtering. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/models">Google models</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/overview">Overview of the Gemini API</a>, and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/send-multimodal-prompts">Send multimodal prompt requests</a>. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Armor</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Armor supports Layer 7 filtering in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/armor/docs/security-policy-overview#expandable-1">globally scoped edge security policies</a> for Media CDN in Preview.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud VMware Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>When you initiate deletion of a private cloud, billing now stops immediately, but the deletion might take up to 24 hours to complete.</p>\n\n<p>This lets you contact support if you need to stop the deletion. During the deletion of the private cloud, it is still visible in the console, and your VMs continue to run.</p>\n\n<p>If necessary, disable or reconfigure networking components.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>GKE now provides insights and recommendations to create a backup plan for unprotected clusters that have existed for more than 7 days. These insights and recommendations are currently available in <code>us-central1-a</code>. See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/concepts/backup-for-gke">Backup for GKE</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/add-on/backup-for-gke/how-to/data-protection-recommendations">protect clusters with Backup for GKE</a> documents for details.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps SOAR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong><a href="https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/soar/release-notes#May_16_2024">Release 6.3.3 is now in General Availability.</a></strong></p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Media CDN</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/media-cdn/docs/use-dual-token-authentication">Dual-token authentication</a> is Generally Available. You can now enable this feature by using the Google Cloud Console in addition to the gcloud SDK and REST API. When this feature is enabled, Media CDN uses a short-duration token and a long-duration token to authenticate requests.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can use the globally scoped edge security policies of Cloud Armor for Layer 7 filtering. This feature is in <strong>Preview</strong>. Try this feature with the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/arima-time-series-forecasting-with-limits-tutorial">Limit forecasted values for a time series model</a>\ntutorial.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>BigQuery ML now offers the following Generative AI features:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/grounding/overview#ground-public">Grounding</a>\nand\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/configure-safety-attributes">safety attributes</a>\nwhen you use Vertex AI Gemini models with the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text"><code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Use the <code>ground_with_google_search</code> argument to perform\ngrounding. This release is in parallel with the CDAP 6.10.1 release.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Creating a private instance with <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/configure-private-service-connect">Private Service Connect</a> is GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Per Namespace Service Accounts are GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/control-access-in-namespace">Access control with namespace service accounts</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Syncing multiple pipelines from a namespace is GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1, For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/source-control-management#sync-pipelines">Sync Cloud Data Fusion pipelines with a remote repository</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Changed in Cloud Data Fusion 6.10.1:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/source-control-management">Source Control Management</a> supports Bitbucket and Gitlab. </li>\n<li>Cloud Data Fusion uses the subnet used by the shared VPC network attachment in the default compute profile.</li>\n<li>Added support for option string field (keep-strings) in <code>parse-xml-to-json</code> Wrangler directive (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20934">CDAP-20934</a>).</li>\n<li>The BigQuery sink plugin doesn\'t provide the <strong>Dedupe By</strong> option while in insert mode (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-900">PLUGIN-900</a>).</li>\n<li>The BigQuery plugin supports the JSON type (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1563">PLUGIN-1563</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved error messages in the Spanner source (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1748">PLUGIN-1748</a>).  </li>\n<li>Improved retries in Pub/Sub plugin (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1769">PLUGIN-1769</a>).</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed in Cloud Data Fusion 6.10.1:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing runtime arguments of pipeline triggers to not propagate to downstream pipelines (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20947">CDAP-20947</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue in Wrangler causing the <code>send-to-error-and-continue</code> directive to not initialize <code>dq_failure</code> when the condition is false (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1736">PLUGIN-1736</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue that occurs if running a replication pipeline when task workers are enabled (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20951">CDAP-20951</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved error reporting in the BigQuery Sink. Fixed an issue in BigQuery Argument Setter where validation error wasn\'t displayed correctly (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-788">PLUGIN-788</a>, <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-781">PLUGIN-781</a>, <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-782">PLUGIN-782</a>,  <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1318">PLUGIN-1318</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved retries in BigQuery plugin (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1715">PLUGIN-1715</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with the Python plugin, where running in native mode doesn\'t work as intended (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1617">PLUGIN-1617</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing certain connection parameters to not propagate in a MySQL connection (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1728">PLUGIN-1728</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing the Cloud Storage Copy action to timeout while working with large files (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1735">PLUGIN-1735</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing Copy and Move plugins to not create buckets at the destination path as expected, resulting in a runtime error (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1738">PLUGIN-1738</a>). </li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing empty source input to fail in multiple plugins (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1742">PLUGIN-1742</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with remote execution of Wrangler directives causing type information to not be emitted (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1778">PLUGIN-1778</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing a <code>No record field provided</code>error (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-21024">CDAP-21024</a>).</li>\n<li>Streaming pipelines in Cloud Data Fusion support the Excel source. Batch pipelines with an Excel source can consume high memory and fail in large pipelines (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1771">PLUGIN-1771</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with using the Conditional plugin as a source for Wrangler, causing CDAP not to fetch the necessary schema (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20890">CDAP-20890</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with instance upgrades causing existing schedule names to be improperly encoded in the URL, resulting in pre-upgrade failure (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20999">CDAP-20999</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with schedules causing the maximum concurrent run property to not work as intended (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20988">CDAP-20988</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing committed ID to incorrectly propagate when pushing pipeline configurations to Git (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20932">CDAP-20932</a>).</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Breaking</h3>\n<p>Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1 has a known issue in the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/configure-cloud-storage-batch-source">Cloud Storage plugin</a> causing pipelines to intermittently fail if the plugin contains a * regex pattern and uses Dataproc 2.0. To mitigate this issue:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/change-dataproc-image#change-to-dataproc-21">Change the Dataproc image to version 2.1</a>.</li>\n<li>Use an older plugin version.</li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/change-dataproc-image#memory-usage">Increase memory for the executor</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Interconnect</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Partner Interconnect support for dual-stack IPv4 and IPv6 is now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/interconnect/concepts/partner-overview#ipv6-support">IPv6 support</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Load Balancing</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Global external Application Load Balancers and global external proxy Network Load Balancers can now load balance IPv6 traffic. The following backends support dual stack:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>VM instance group</li>\n<li>Zonal NEGs (GCE_VM_IP_PORT)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>You can now migrate the load balancer from IPv4 based deployments to dual stack (IPv4 and IPv6) deployments. </p>\n\n<p>For details, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/ipv6">IPv6 termination for external Application Load Balancers and external proxy Network Load Balancers</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/migrate-global-ext-https-dualstack">Migrate global external Application Load Balancer to dual-stack backends</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/migrate-global-ext-proxy-dualstack">Migrate global external proxy Network Load Balancers to dual-stack backends</a></p></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>This feature is available in <strong>Preview</strong>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Router</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Router supports BGP route policies in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Public Preview</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/router/concepts/bgp-route-policies-overview">BGP route policies overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Router support for IPv6 BGP sessions is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/router/concepts/overview#bgp-ips">BGP peering IP addresses</a>.</p>\n<h2 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Application Integration</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Application Integration is now available in Milan (<code>europe-west8</code>). For a list of supported regions, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/application-integration/docs/locations">Application Integration locations</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Backup and DR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Backup and DR Service 11.0.11.323 is now available to update your backup/recovery appliance. Refer to these <a href="https://cloud.google.com/backup-disaster-recovery/docs/configuration/update-appliance">instructions</a> to update your appliance.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup and DR Service supports migrating from manual protection to the new dynamic protection using tags. It is now also supported on all types of backup/recovery appliances. <a href="https://cloud.google.com/backup-disaster-recovery/docs/create-plan/dynamic-protection#migrate_manual_protection_to_dynamic_protection">Learn more</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Backup and DR Service now supports auto patch updates. <a href="https://cloud.google.com/backup-disaster-recovery/docs/configuration/update-appliance">Learn more</a>.</p>\n<h3>Issue</h3>\n<p>If the management console and backup/recovery appliance connectivity is not established for more than 6 hours, contact customer support to resolve the issue. This is particularly relevant to the appliance running on version 11.0.11.323 or later. You can check the connection status from the Connectivity column in the <strong>Manage</strong> &gt; <strong>Appliances</strong> page.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bare Metal Solution</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now order Performance SSD storage for your Bare Metal Solution. For more information and availability in your region, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/bms-planning#performance_ssd_storage">Performance SSD storage</a>. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>. To learn how to order Performance SSD storage, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/order-bms-resources">Order Bare Metal Solution resources</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following Generative AI features are now in\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">preview</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Creating\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-create-remote-model">remote models</a>\nbased on the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/models#gemini-models">Vertex AI <code>gemini-1.5-pro</code> foundation model</a>.</li>\n<li>Using the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text"><code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>\nwith these remote models to perform generative natural language tasks for\ntext stored in BigQuery tables.</li>\n<li>Using the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/reference/standard-sql/bigqueryml-syntax-generate-text"><code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a>\nwith these remote models to perform generative AI tasks, for example audio\ntranscription or document classification, using image, video, audio, PDF,\nor text content stored in BigQuery\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/object-table-introduction">object tables</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Try these features with the\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/generate-text">Generate text by using the <code>ML.GENERATE_TEXT</code> function</a> how-to topic.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Data Fusion</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1 is generally available (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>). This release is in parallel with the CDAP 6.10.1 release.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Creating a private instance with <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/configure-private-service-connect">Private Service Connect</a> is GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Per Namespace Service Accounts are GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/control-access-in-namespace">Access control with namespace service accounts</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Syncing multiple pipelines from a namespace is GA in Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1, For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/source-control-management#sync-pipelines">Sync Cloud Data Fusion pipelines with a remote repository</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Changed in Cloud Data Fusion 6.10.1:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/source-control-management">Source Control Management</a> supports Bitbucket and Gitlab. </li>\n<li>Cloud Data Fusion uses the subnet used by the shared VPC network attachment in the default compute profile.</li>\n<li>Added support for option string field (keep-strings) in <code>parse-xml-to-json</code> Wrangler directive (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20934">CDAP-20934</a>).</li>\n<li>The BigQuery sink plugin doesn\'t provide the <strong>Dedupe By</strong> option while in insert mode (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-900">PLUGIN-900</a>).</li>\n<li>The BigQuery plugin supports the JSON type (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1563">PLUGIN-1563</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved error messages in the Spanner source (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1748">PLUGIN-1748</a>).  </li>\n<li>Improved retries in Pub/Sub plugin (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1769">PLUGIN-1769</a>).</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed in Cloud Data Fusion 6.10.1:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing runtime arguments of pipeline triggers to not propagate to downstream pipelines (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20947">CDAP-20947</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue in Wrangler causing the <code>send-to-error-and-continue</code> directive to not initialize <code>dq_failure</code> when the condition is false (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1736">PLUGIN-1736</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue that occurs if running a replication pipeline when task workers are enabled (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20951">CDAP-20951</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved error reporting in the BigQuery Sink. Fixed an issue in BigQuery Argument Setter where validation error wasn\'t displayed correctly (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-788">PLUGIN-788</a>, <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-781">PLUGIN-781</a>, <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-782">PLUGIN-782</a>,  <a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1318">PLUGIN-1318</a>).</li>\n<li>Improved retries in BigQuery plugin (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1715">PLUGIN-1715</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with the Python plugin, where running in native mode doesn\'t work as intended (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1617">PLUGIN-1617</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing certain connection parameters to not propagate in a MySQL connection (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1728">PLUGIN-1728</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing the Cloud Storage Copy action to timeout while working with large files (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1735">PLUGIN-1735</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing Copy and Move plugins to not create buckets at the destination path as expected, resulting in a runtime error (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1738">PLUGIN-1738</a>). </li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing empty source input to fail in multiple plugins (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1742">PLUGIN-1742</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with remote execution of Wrangler directives causing type information to not be emitted (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1778">PLUGIN-1778</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing a <code>No record field provided</code>error (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-21024">CDAP-21024</a>).</li>\n<li>Streaming pipelines in Cloud Data Fusion support the Excel source. Batch pipelines with an Excel source can consume high memory and fail in large pipelines (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/PLUGIN-1771">PLUGIN-1771</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with using the Conditional plugin as a source for Wrangler, causing CDAP not to fetch the necessary schema (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20890">CDAP-20890</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with instance upgrades causing existing schedule names to be improperly encoded in the URL, resulting in pre-upgrade failure (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20999">CDAP-20999</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue with schedules causing the maximum concurrent run property to not work as intended (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20988">CDAP-20988</a>).</li>\n<li>Fixed an issue causing committed ID to incorrectly propagate when pushing pipeline configurations to Git (<a href="https://cdap.atlassian.net/browse/CDAP-20932">CDAP-20932</a>).</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Breaking</h3>\n<p>Cloud Data Fusion version 6.10.1 has a known issue in the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/configure-cloud-storage-batch-source">Cloud Storage plugin</a> causing pipelines to intermittently fail if the plugin contains a * regex pattern and uses Dataproc 2.0. To mitigate this issue:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/change-dataproc-image#change-to-dataproc-21">Change the Dataproc image to version 2.1</a>.</li>\n<li>Use an older plugin version.</li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/data-fusion/docs/how-to/change-dataproc-image#memory-usage">Increase memory for the executor</a>.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Interconnect</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Partner Interconnect support for dual-stack IPv4 and IPv6 is now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/interconnect/concepts/partner-overview#ipv6-support">IPv6 support</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Load Balancing</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Global external Application Load Balancers and global external proxy Network Load Balancers can now load balance IPv6 traffic. The following backends support dual stack:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>VM instance group</li>\n<li>Zonal NEGs (GCE_VM_IP_PORT)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>You can now migrate the load balancer from IPv4 based deployments to dual stack (IPv4 and IPv6) deployments. </p>\n\n<p>For details, see:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/ipv6">IPv6 termination for external Application Load Balancers and external proxy Network Load Balancers</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/migrate-global-ext-https-dualstack">Migrate global external Application Load Balancer to dual-stack backends</a></p></li>\n<li><p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/migrate-global-ext-proxy-dualstack">Migrate global external proxy Network Load Balancers to dual-stack backends</a></p></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>This feature is available in <strong>Preview</strong>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Router</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Router supports BGP route policies in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Public Preview</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/router/concepts/bgp-route-policies-overview">BGP route policies overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Router support for IPv6 BGP sessions is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/network-connectivity/docs/router/concepts/overview#bgp-ips">BGP peering IP addresses</a>.</p>\n<h2 boards.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2024-26900 in the Linux kernel.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dialogflow</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Vertex AI Agents</strong>: OpenAPI tools now support <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/vertex/docs/concept/tools#openapi_tool_private_network_access">private network access</a></p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Vertex AI Agents</strong>: OpenAPI tool authentication now supports <a 3.2.3.1</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>Existing private clouds will be upgraded in May and June 2024.</p>\n\n<p>For more details on the contents of this upgrade, see <a Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r16_version_updates">(2024-R16) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r16_version_updates">(2024-R16) Version updates</h4>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Version <a planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Rapid channel will be upgraded from version 1.28 to version <a release.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r16_version_updates">(2024-R16) Version updates</h4>\n\n<ul>\n<li>The following versions are now available:\n<ul>\n<li><a <code>TIMESTAMP</code> data types. target="_blank">79f6c46</a>)</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Generative AI on Vertex AI</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following models have been added to <a href="https://console.cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/model-garden">Model Garden</a>:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>E5</strong>: A text embedding model series that can be served with a GPU or CPU.</li>\n<li><strong>Instant ID</strong>: An identity preserving text-to-image generation model.</li>\n<li><strong>Stable Diffusion XL lightning</strong>: A text-to-image generation model that is based on SDXL but requires fewer inference iterations. </li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>To see a list of all available models, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/start/explore-models">Explore models in Model Garden</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Armor</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Armor now supports regional internal Application Load Balancers in public preview. You can use the regional backend security policy type with this load balancer. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/armor/docs/security-policy-overview#policy-types">types of security policies</a>.</p>\n<h2 clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#1293-gke600">1.29.3-gke.600</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#1288-gke800">1.28.8-gke.800</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#12712-gke800">1.27.12-gke.800</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee X</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 17, 2024, we released an updated version of Apigee (1-12-0-apigee-4-hotfix).</p>\n<aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Rollouts of this release to production instances will begin within two business days and may take four or more business days to complete across all Google Cloud zones. Your instances may not have the features and fixes available until the rollout is complete.</span></aside>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<table>\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th>Bug ID</th>\n<th>Description</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>337876238, 330314128, 333762214</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Resolved issues resulting in an increase in <code>404/503</code> responses.</strong><p>Upgraded storage for the Apigee router to the latest version to resolve <code>404</code> responses.</p><p>Adjusted traffic weight and delays in the older replica set to handle traffic divergence during the release process to address any <code>5xx</code> responses.</p></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>335832119</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Fixed 404 errors caused during Apigee instance update/rollback.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>255772956</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Turned off asynchronous services callout when the <code>&lt;Response&gt;</code> element is not present due to inconsistent scaling of runtime pods.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>338717278</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Reverted problematic commit to address thread pool exhaustion.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Navigation menus in the <a href="https://apigee.google.com/edge">Classic Apigee UI</a> have been restored to support the transition from the Classic console to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/console/apigee">Apigee in the Google Cloud console</a>. </p>\n\n<p>Each menu item in the Classic console now directs you to the corresponding feature location in the Cloud console where you can carry out your task. Please see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/fundamentals/ui-overview#console-compare">Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation</a> for more details.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Correction</strong>: Apigee hybrid entitlements are available in Apigee Subscription 2024 plans.  For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/subscription-entitlements#subscription-2024-entitlements">Apigee Subscription 2024 entitlements</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">App Engine flexible environment Node.js</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/nodejs/runtime">Node.js .22</a> is now available <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">in preview</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">App Engine standard environment Node.js</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/standard/nodejs/runtime">Node.js 22</a> is now available <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">in preview</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Billing</h2>\n<h3>Deprecated</h3>\n<p><strong>The Cost Estimation API is deprecated</strong></p>\n\n<p>To get estimates for your planned Google Cloud workloads, use the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/calculator">Google Cloud pricing calculator</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Functions</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Functions (2nd gen) now supports the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/functions/docs/concepts/nodejs-runtime">Node.js 22</a> runtime at the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">Preview release level</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Run</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Run is now covered by <a href="https://cloud.google.com/security/compliance/fedramp">FedRAMP High</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Config Controller</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Config Controller now uses the following versions of its included products:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Config Connector v1.117.0, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/config-connector/docs/release-notes#May_13_2024">release notes</a></li>\n<li>Anthos Config Management v1.17.3, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/release-notes#March_21_2024">release notes</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataflow</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Dataflow no longer supports the NVIDIA Tesla K80  GPU type. For a list of supported GPU types, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataflow/docs/gpu/gpu-support#availability">Dataflow support for GPUs</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Deep Learning Containers</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated the R CPU container image from R 4.3 to R 4.4. The R 4.3 container image is deprecated. There will be no further updates to this image in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Deep Learning VM Images</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>CUDA 12.2 images are now available.</li>\n<li>Updated TensorFlow 2.15 images from CUDA 12.1 to CUDA 12.2.</li>\n<li>Re-enabled <code>common-gpu</code> Deep Learning VM releases that were erroneously deactivated in M117.</li>\n<li>Updated Nvidia drivers to 550.54.15 to fix an issue where Nvidia drivers failed to install on startup after Debian 11 images upgraded kernel to <code>linux-image-5.10.0-29-cloud-amd64</code>.</li>\n<li>The <code>linux-headers-cloud-amd64</code> metapackage is now installed for faster driver recompiling on kernel upgrades.</li>\n<li>TensorFlow 2.6 CPU and GPU images are deprecated. There will be no further updates to these images in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r14_version_updates">(2024-R14) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>There are no version updates for 2024-R14.</p>\n\n<h4 id="2024-r15_version_updates">(2024-R15) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. For more\ninformation on versioning and upgrades, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/versioning">GKE versioning and support</a>\nand <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/upgrades">Upgrades</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>No channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. the Regular channel will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1291">1.29.1-gke.1589020</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n<section><h3>Rapid channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1289">1.28.9-gke.1209000</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Rapid channel will be upgraded from version 1.28 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1289">1.28.9-gke.1209000</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r14_version_updates">(2024-R14) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>There are no version updates for 2024-R14.</p>\n\n<h4 are now available in the Regular channel:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12615">1.26.15-gke.1191000</a></li>\n<li><a SecOps SOAR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Release 6.3.2 is now in General Availability.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">NetApp Volumes</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>NetApp Volumes now supports large capacity volumes (in Preview). For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/netapp/volumes/docs/configure-and-use/volumes/overview#large_capacity_volumes_preview">Large capacity volumes</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Policy Intelligence</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The IAM recommender generates policy insights and role recommendations for identities in Workload Identity Federation pools. To learn more, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/policy-intelligence/docs/role-recommendations-overview#availability">Availability</a>. This feature is available in Preview.</p>\n\n<p>During Preview, the actual <a href="https://cloud.google.com/policy-intelligence/docs/role-recommendations-overview#observation-period">observation period</a> might be shorter than the observation period listed in recommendations for these principals.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Sensitive Data Protection</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <code>LOCATION</code> <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/infotypes-reference">infoType</a> detection model that was previously only accessible by setting <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a> to <code>latest</code> has been promoted to be the default detection model for this infoType. The new model offers improved detection quality.</p>\n\n<p>To use the new model, leave  <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a> unset, or set it to <code>latest</code> or <code>stable</code>. To use the old detection model, set <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a>  to <code>legacy</code>. You can continue to use the legacy model for 90 days.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Storage Transfer Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Storage Transfer Service now supports transfers from Amazon S3 over a Google-managed private network. Transfer jobs that select this option pay no AWS egress fees; instead, a flat per-GiB rate is charged by Google Cloud. This allows you to transfer data at a potentially lower overall cost.</p>\n\n<p>Learn more about <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage-transfer/docs/create-transfers/agentless/s3#egress_options">egress options for S3 transfers</a>, including the managed private network.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Logging for Storage Transfer Service now supports transfers involving POSIX file systems.</p>\n\n<p>See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage-transfer/docs/transfer-logs">Cloud Logging for Storage Transfer Service</a> for more details.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Workbench</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench user-managed notebooks includes the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated Nvidia drivers to 550.54.15 to fix an issue where Nvidia drivers failed to install on startup after Debian 11 images upgraded kernel to <code>linux-image-5.10.0-29-cloud-amd64</code>.</li>\n<li>The <code>linux-headers-cloud-amd64</code> metapackage is now installed for faster driver recompiling on kernel upgrades.</li>\n<li>TensorFlow 2.6 CPU and GPU images are deprecated. There will be no further updates to these images in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench managed notebooks includes the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated the R CPU kernel from R 4.3 to R 4.4.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances includes the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated Nvidia drivers to 550.54.15 to fix an issue where Nvidia drivers failed to install on startup after Debian 11 images upgraded kernel to <code>linux-image-5.10.0-29-cloud-amd64</code>.</li>\n<li>The <code>linux-headers-cloud-amd64</code> metapackage is now installed for faster driver recompiling on kernel upgrades.</li>\n</ul>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos clusters on Azure</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>You can now launch clusters with the following Kubernetes versions. Click on the following links to see the release notes associated with these patches:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#1293-gke600">1.29.3-gke.600</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#1288-gke800">1.28.8-gke.800</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/multi-cloud/azure/reference/supported-versions#12712-gke800">1.27.12-gke.800</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee X</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 17, 2024, we released an updated version of Apigee (1-12-0-apigee-4-hotfix).</p>\n<aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Rollouts of this release to production instances will begin within two business days and may take four or more business days to complete across all Google Cloud zones. Your instances may not have the features and fixes available until the rollout is complete.</span></aside>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<table>\n<thead>\n<tr>\n<th>Bug ID</th>\n<th>Description</th>\n</tr>\n</thead>\n\n<tbody>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>337876238, 330314128, 333762214</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Resolved issues resulting in an increase in <code>404/503</code> responses.</strong><p>Upgraded storage for the Apigee router to the latest version to resolve <code>404</code> responses.</p><p>Adjusted traffic weight and delays in the older replica set to handle traffic divergence during the release process to address any <code>5xx</code> responses.</p></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>335832119</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Fixed 404 errors caused during Apigee instance update/rollback.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>255772956</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Turned off asynchronous services callout when the <code>&lt;Response&gt;</code> element is not present due to inconsistent scaling of runtime pods.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td><strong>338717278</strong></td>\n<td><strong>Reverted problematic commit to address thread pool exhaustion.</strong></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Navigation menus in the <a href="https://apigee.google.com/edge">Classic Apigee UI</a> have been restored to support the transition from the Classic console to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/console/apigee">Apigee in the Google Cloud console</a>. </p>\n\n<p>Each menu item in the Classic console now directs you to the corresponding feature location in the Cloud console where you can carry out your task. Please see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/fundamentals/ui-overview#console-compare">Apigee UI in Cloud console navigation</a> for more details.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Correction</strong>: Apigee hybrid entitlements are available in Apigee Subscription 2024 plans.  For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/subscription-entitlements#subscription-2024-entitlements">Apigee Subscription 2024 entitlements</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">App Engine flexible environment Node.js</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a The R 4.3 container image is deprecated. There will be no further updates to this image in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Deep Learning VM Images</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>CUDA 12.2 images are now available.</li>\n<li>Updated TensorFlow 2.15 images from CUDA 12.1 to CUDA 12.2.</li>\n<li>Re-enabled <code>common-gpu</code> Deep Learning VM releases that were erroneously deactivated in M117.</li>\n<li>Updated Nvidia drivers to 550.54.15 to fix an issue where Nvidia drivers failed to install on startup after Debian 11 images upgraded kernel to <code>linux-image-5.10.0-29-cloud-amd64</code>.</li>\n<li>The <code>linux-headers-cloud-amd64</code> metapackage is now installed for faster driver recompiling on kernel upgrades.</li>\n<li>TensorFlow 2.6 CPU and GPU images are deprecated. There will be no further updates to these images in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r14_version_updates">(2024-R14) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>There are no version updates for 2024-R14.</p>\n\n<h4 id="2024-r15_version_updates">(2024-R15) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>GKE cluster versions have been updated.</p>\n\n<p><strong>New versions available for upgrades and new clusters.</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1289">1.28.9-gke.1250000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1289">1.28.9-gke.1289000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1293">1.29.3-gke.1282005</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1447001</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1542000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1294">1.29.4-gke.1670000</a></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>The following versions are no longer available:\n<ul>\n<li>1.26.8-gke.200</li>\n<li>1.26.14-gke.1044000</li>\n<li>1.27.8-gke.1067004</li>\n<li>1.29.3-gke.1282000</li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.26 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062003</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.27 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062003</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.28 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1288">1.28.8-gke.1095000</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.29.md#v1291">1.29.1-gke.1589020</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n<section><h3>Stable channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. Rollouts are already in progress\nwhen we publish the release notes, and can take multiple days to complete across all Google Cloud\nzones.</span></aside>\n<ul>\n<li>Version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062003</a> is now the default version in the Stable channel.</li>\n<li>The following versions are now available in the Stable channel:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12615">1.26.15-gke.1090000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12712">1.27.12-gke.1115000</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1288">1.28.8-gke.1095000</a></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>The following versions are no longer available in the Stable channel:\n<ul>\n<li>1.26.8-gke.200</li>\n<li>1.26.14-gke.1044000</li>\n<li>1.27.11-gke.1062001</li>\n</ul></li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.25 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12614">1.26.14-gke.1044001</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.26 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062003</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.27 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.27.md#v12711">1.27.11-gke.1062003</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Stable channel will be upgraded from version 1.28 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1287">1.28.7-gke.1026001</a> with this release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n<section><h3>Regular channel</h3><aside will be upgraded from version 1.28 to version <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.28.md#v1288">1.28.8-gke.1095000</a> with this release.</li>\n<li>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled will be upgraded from version 1.29 to version <a SecOps SOAR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Release 6.3.2 is now in General Availability.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">NetApp Volumes</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>NetApp Volumes now supports large capacity volumes (in Preview). For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/netapp/volumes/docs/configure-and-use/volumes/overview#large_capacity_volumes_preview">Large capacity volumes</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Policy Intelligence</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The IAM recommender generates policy insights and role recommendations for identities in Workload Identity Federation pools. To learn more, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/policy-intelligence/docs/role-recommendations-overview#availability">Availability</a>. This feature is available in Preview.</p>\n\n<p>During Preview, the actual <a href="https://cloud.google.com/policy-intelligence/docs/role-recommendations-overview#observation-period">observation period</a> might be shorter than the observation period listed in recommendations for these principals.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Sensitive Data Protection</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <code>LOCATION</code> <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/infotypes-reference">infoType</a> detection model that was previously only accessible by setting <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a> to <code>latest</code> has been promoted to be the default detection model for this infoType. The new model offers improved detection quality.</p>\n\n<p>To use the new model, leave  <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a> unset, or set it to <code>latest</code> or <code>stable</code>. To use the old detection model, set <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dlp/docs/reference/rest/v2/InfoType"><code>InfoType.version</code></a>  to <code>legacy</code>. You can continue to use the legacy model for 90 days.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Storage Transfer Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Storage Transfer Service now supports transfers from Amazon S3 over a Google-managed private network. Transfer jobs that select this option pay no AWS egress fees; instead, a flat per-GiB rate is charged by Google Cloud. This allows you to transfer data at a potentially lower overall cost.</p>\n\n<p>Learn more about <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage-transfer/docs/create-transfers/agentless/s3#egress_options">egress options for S3 transfers</a>, including the managed private network.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud Logging for Storage Transfer Service now supports transfers involving POSIX file systems.</p>\n\n<p>See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/storage-transfer/docs/transfer-logs">Cloud Logging for Storage Transfer Service</a> for more details.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Vertex AI Workbench</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench user-managed notebooks includes the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated Nvidia drivers to 550.54.15 to fix an issue where Nvidia drivers failed to install on startup after Debian 11 images upgraded kernel to <code>linux-image-5.10.0-29-cloud-amd64</code>.</li>\n<li>The <code>linux-headers-cloud-amd64</code> metapackage is now installed for faster driver recompiling on kernel upgrades.</li>\n<li>TensorFlow 2.6 CPU and GPU images are deprecated. There will be no further updates to these images in future releases.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench managed notebooks includes the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Updated the R CPU kernel from R 4.3 to R 4.4.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>M121 release</strong></p>\n\n<p>The M121 release of Vertex AI Workbench instances 'value': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee Integrated Portal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 16, 2024 we released a new version of the Apigee integrated portal.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>This release includes general improvements to performance and availability.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Billing</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Generate a SQL query to BigQuery from your Cloud Billing Reports (in preview)</strong></p>\n\n<p>In the cloud console, on the Billing <strong>Reports</strong> page, you use the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports#filtering_and_grouping">report settings and filters</a> to refine the data returned to your report. If you have enabled <a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery"><strong>Cloud Billing data export to BigQuery</strong></a>, you can analyze your\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery-tables">exported billing data</a> using SQL queries. In Billing Reports, you can now click a button to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports#generate-query"><strong>generate a SQL query</strong></a> in BigQuery that is configured to use the equivalent Billing Report settings and filters to query your exported billing data. When run against your exported billing data, the generated query returns the <em>equivalent results</em> in BigQuery as the results in the Billing Report.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports">Learn more about Billing Reports</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery">Learn more about Billing data export to BigQuery</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports#generate-query">Learn more about generating a SQL query from a billing report</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Healthcare API</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The <code>fhir_read_ops</code>, <code>fhir_write_ops</code>, and <code>fhir_search_ops</code> quota metrics are generally available (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>) and have replaced the legacy <code>fhir_ops</code> quota metric. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/healthcare-api/quotas#fhir-quotas">FHIR quotas</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Key Management Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud KMS with Autokey is now in Preview for Cloud Storage, Compute Engine,  BigQuery, and Secret Manager.</p>\n\n<p>Autokey simplifies creating and using <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/cmek">customer-managed encryption keys (CMEKs)</a> by automating provisioning and assignment. With Autokey, key rings, keys, and service accounts don\'t need to be planned and provisioned before they\'re needed. Instead, Autokey generates keys on demand as resources are created.</p>\n\n<p>Using keys generated by Autokey can help you consistently align with industry standards and recommended practices for data security, including the HSM protection level, separation of duties, key rotation, location, and key specificity.  Keys requested using Autokey function identically to other Cloud HSM keys with the same settings.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/autokey-overview">Autokey overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud KMS has two new organization policy constraints that you can use to control key version destruction. These constraints became available on November 1, 2023.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/control-key-destruction">Control key version destruction</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Config Connector</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Config Connector version 1.118.1 is now available.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>This release introduces the direct-reconciliation mechanism to reconcile Config Connector resources. The reconciliation makes API calls directly instead of going through a third-party library. Currently it only applies to <code>LoggingLogMetric</code>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>LoggingLogMetric</code> now uses direct reconciliation.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Added support for <code>ComputeNetworkFirewallPolicyRule</code> resource (v1alpha1).</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>LoggingLogMetric</code></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Added <code>spec.loggingLogBucketRef</code> field to support bucket reference.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><code>SQLInstance</code> avoids a bug causing repeated reconciliation when <code>spec.settings.edition</code> was configured with a non-empty value.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a These attributes let Looker Studio administrators audit and monitor how Looker Studio users in their organization interact with schedules and alerts.</p>\n\n<p><a href="https://support.google.com/looker-studio/answer/9690662">Learn more about audit log events in Looker Studio</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Looker data sources now display LookML filters</strong></p>\n\n<p>Filters that are defined in LookML models with the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-explore-conditionally-filter"><code>conditionally_filter</code></a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/reference/param-explore-always-filter"><code>always_filter</code></a> LookML parameters are now displayed in Looker Studio charts with a Looker data source.</p>\n\n<p><a href="https://support.google.com/looker-studio/answer/12388266#lookml-filters">Learn more about LookML filters for Looker data sources</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">NetApp Volumes</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>NetApp Volumes now supports Google Cloud VMware Engine Peering Automation. If you have enabled <a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery"><strong>Cloud Billing data export to BigQuery</strong></a>, you can analyze your\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery-tables">exported billing data</a> using SQL queries. In Billing Reports, you can now click a button to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports#generate-query"><strong>generate a SQL query</strong></a> in BigQuery that is configured to use the equivalent Billing Report settings and filters to query your exported billing data. When run against your exported billing data, the generated query returns the <em>equivalent results</em> in BigQuery as the results in the Billing Report.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports">Learn more about Billing Reports</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/export-data-bigquery">Learn more about Billing data export to BigQuery</a></li>\n<li><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/reports#generate-query">Learn more about generating a SQL query from a billing report</a></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Healthcare API</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The <code>fhir_read_ops</code>, <code>fhir_write_ops</code>, and <code>fhir_search_ops</code> quota metrics are generally available (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>) and have replaced the legacy <code>fhir_ops</code> quota metric. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/healthcare-api/quotas#fhir-quotas">FHIR quotas</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Key Management Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud KMS with Autokey is now in Preview for Cloud Storage, Compute Engine,  BigQuery, and Secret Manager.</p>\n\n<p>Autokey simplifies creating and using <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/cmek">customer-managed encryption keys (CMEKs)</a> by automating provisioning and assignment. With Autokey, key rings, keys, and service accounts don\'t need to be planned and provisioned before they\'re needed. Instead, Autokey generates keys on demand as resources are created.</p>\n\n<p>Using keys generated by Autokey can help you consistently align with industry standards and recommended practices for data security, including the HSM protection level, separation of duties, key rotation, location, and key specificity.  Keys requested using Autokey function identically to other Cloud HSM keys with the same settings.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/autokey-overview">Autokey overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Cloud KMS has two new organization policy constraints that you can use to control key version destruction. These constraints became available on November 1, 2023.</p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kms/docs/control-key-destruction">Control key version destruction</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Config Connector</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Config Connector version 1.118.1 is now available.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>This release introduces the direct-reconciliation mechanism to reconcile Config Connector resources. The reconciliation makes API calls directly instead of going through a third-party library. Currently it only applies to <code>LoggingLogMetric</code>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>LoggingLogMetric</code> now uses direct reconciliation.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Added support for <code>ComputeNetworkFirewallPolicyRule</code> resource (v1alpha1).</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>LoggingLogMetric</code></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Added <code>spec.loggingLogBucketRef</code> field to support bucket reference.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><code>SQLInstance</code> avoids a bug causing repeated reconciliation when <code>spec.settings.edition</code> was configured with a non-empty value.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a Starting June 17, 2024, if your organization hasn\'t previously used Cloud Source Repositories, you cannot enable the API or use Cloud Source Repositories. New projects not connected to an organization can\'t enable the Cloud Source Repositories API after June 17, 2024. Customers who have already enabled the API prior to this date will not be affected and can continue to use Cloud Source Repositories.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Generally Available:</strong> Advanced maintenance control for sole-tenancy lets you control planned maintenance events for sole-tenant node groups and minimize maintenance-related disruptions. This\nfeature is available only for sole-tenant node groups. To use this feature with your existing virtual machines, you must first move your VMs to sole-tenant node groups that have advanced maintenance\ncontrol enabled.</p>\n\n<p>The advanced maintenance control for sole-tenancy feature lets you:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Check for maintenance events scheduled for a sole-tenant node 28 days in advance.</li>\n<li>Trigger maintenance immediately or schedule it for later. Note that if you trigger maintenance \nimmediately, the maintenance takes place within 6 hours from the time you trigger the request.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see  <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/nodes/sole-tenancy-advanced-maintenance-control">Advanced maintenance control for sole-tenancy</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Registry</h2>\n<h3>Deprecated</h3>\n<p>Effective May 15, 2024, Artifact Registry <a href="https://cloud.google.com/artifact-registry/docs/transition/gcr-on-ar">hosts all images for the <code>gcr.io</code> domain</a> in projects without previous Container Registry usage.</p>\n\n<p>If you use Container Registry, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/container-registry/docs/deprecations/container-registry-deprecation">learn about the deprecation</a>. To get started with managing containers on Google Cloud, use <a href="https://cloud.google.com/artifact-registry/docs">Artifact Registry</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_129100-gke251">Release 1.29.100-gke.251</h3>\n\n<p>GKE on Bare Metal 1.29.100-gke.251 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. GKE on Bare Metal 1.29.100-gke.251 runs on Kubernetes 1.29.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">GDCV Ready storage partners</a> document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of GKE on Bare Metal.</p>\n<h3>Breaking</h3>\n<ul>\n<li><p>Added new API and IAM role requirements for Cloud Monitoring:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>You must enable the <code>kubernetesmetadata.googleapis.com</code> API for your project and grant the <code>roles/kubernetesmetadata.publisher</code> IAM role to the Logging and Monitoring service account (<code>anthos-baremetal-cloud-ops</code>, when created automatically). Clusters use this API as an endpoint to send Kubernetes metadata to Google Cloud. The metadata is vital for cluster monitoring, debugging, and recovery. If you <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/installing/proxy">install your clusters behind a proxy</a>, add <code>kubernetesmetadata.googleapis.com</code> to the list of allowed connections.</p></li>\n<li><p>Due to changes in the way service accounts are checked, you must also grant the following IAM roles to the Logging and Monitoring service account:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><code>roles/monitoring.viewer</code></p></li>\n<li><p><code>roles/serviceusage.serviceUsageViewer</code></p></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>These API and IAM role requirements apply to both creating new 1.29 clusters and upgrading existing clusters to 1.29.</p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Functionality changes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Added checks to validate the SSH client certificate file type before saving the certificate as a Secret.</p></li>\n<li><p>Deprecated the <code>spec.gkeVersion</code> field in <code>Machine</code> and <code>BareMetalMachine</code> custom resources. After GKE on Bare Metal release 1.30, the value of <code>gkeVersion</code> isn\'t guaranteed to be reliable.</p></li>\n<li><p>Added preflight checks for available disk space in specific directories:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>During cluster creation, the following directories are checked:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p><code>/</code> (the root directory) has at least 4&nbsp;GiB of free space</p></li>\n<li><p><code>/var/log/fluent-bit-buffers</code> has at least 12&nbsp;GiB of free space</p></li>\n<li><p><code>/var/opt/buffered-metrics</code> has at least 10016&nbsp;MiB of free space</p></li>\n</ul></li>\n<li><p>During a cluster upgrade, the following directory is checked:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><code>/</code> (the root directory) has at least 2&nbsp;GiB of free space</li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p><strong>Fixes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Fixed an issue where the kubelet doesn\'t honor shortened, 1-second grace period for pod deletion during eviction-based draining.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following container image security vulnerabilities have been fixed in 1.29.100-gke.251: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Medium-severity This\nfeature is available only for sole-tenant node groups. To use this feature with your existing virtual machines, you must first move your VMs to sole-tenant node groups that have advanced maintenance\ncontrol enabled.</p>\n\n<p>The advanced maintenance control for sole-tenancy feature lets you:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Check for maintenance events scheduled for a sole-tenant node 28 days in advance.</li>\n<li>Trigger maintenance immediately or schedule it for later.
