To get started, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/developer-connect/docs/connect-repo">Quickstart</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Generative AI on Vertex AI</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>Gemini 1.5 Flash (Preview)</strong></p>\n\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/send-multimodal-prompts">Gemini 1.5 Flash</a> (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versioning#preview-models"><code>gemini-1.5-flash-preview-0514</code></a>) is available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products?e=13802955&amp;hl=en#product-launch-stages">Preview</a>. Gemini 1.5 Flash is a multimodal model designed for fast, high volume, cost-effective text generation and chat applications. It can analyze text, code, audio, PDF, video, and video with audio.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Grounding Gemini with Google Search is GA</strong></p>\n\n<p>The Gemini API Grounding with Google Search feature is available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">GA</a>. This is available for Gemini 1.0 Pro models. To learn more about model grounding, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/ground-gemini#web-ground-gemini">Grounding with Google Search</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Batch prediction support for Gemini</strong></p>\n\n<p>Batch prediction is available for Gemini in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">preview</a>. Available Gemini models include Gemini 1.0 Pro, Gemini 1.5 Pro, and Gemini 1.5 Flash. To get started with batch prediction, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/multimodal/batch-prediction-gemini">Get batch predictions for Gemini</a>.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>PaliGemma model</strong></p>\n\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/open-models/use-gemma">PaliGemma</a> model is available. PaliGemma is a lightweight open model that\'s part of the Google Gemma model family. It\'s the Gemma model family\'s best model option for image captioning tasks and visual question and answering tasks. Gemma models are based on Gemini models and intended to be extended by customers.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>New stable text embedding models</strong></p>\n\n<p>The following text embedding The API returns support scores and citations.</p>\n\n<p>Filler and introductory statements can be deemed as not requiring attribution. No scores or citations are provided for those statements.</p>\n\n<p>Additionally, as an experimental feature, the API also generates contradicting citations that show which facts contradict the text available.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>This release improves our support for VertexAI.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIDataSet</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>The KMS key is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.encryptionSpec.kmsKeyNameRef</code></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIIndex</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>Note that <code>isCompleteOverwrite</code> is currently not supported: it is not obviously compatible with declarative operation.</p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIEndpoint</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>The KMS key is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.encryptionSpec.kmsKeyNameRef</code></p></li>\n<li><p>The network is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.networkRef</code></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>ComputeNetwork</code></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>The <code>spec.enableUlaInternalIpv6</code> field is no longer immutable - it can now\nbe changed without recreating the network.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Optimized OS</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h3 id="cos-113-18244-85-5_">cos-113-18244-85-5 (CVE-2024-26581) was discovered in the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-028">GCP-2024-028 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability (CVE-2024-26581) was discovered in the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-028">GCP-2024-028 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Media CDN</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Media CDN supports <a href="https://cloud.google.com/media-cdn/docs/custom-headers#header-variables">content targeting</a>, which helps you cache and deliver assets that are customized for your end-user contexts. It enables device characterization and geo-targeting, which are useful for implementing responsive websites, language customization, and currency settings.</p>\n<h2 Use this metric to view all read latencies and filter latencies by change stream or non-change stream reads. available.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>This release improves our support for VertexAI.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIDataSet</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>The KMS key is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.encryptionSpec.kmsKeyNameRef</code></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIIndex</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>Note that <code>isCompleteOverwrite</code> is currently not supported: it is not obviously compatible with declarative operation.</p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>VertexAIEndpoint</code> is promoted from alpha to beta.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Output fields are now in <code>status.observedState</code>.</p></li>\n<li><p>The KMS key is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.encryptionSpec.kmsKeyNameRef</code></p></li>\n<li><p>The network is now specified using a reference: <code>spec.networkRef</code></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><code>ComputeNetwork</code></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>The <code>spec.enableUlaInternalIpv6</code> field is no longer immutable - it can now\nbe changed without recreating the network.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Optimized OS</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h3 id="cos-113-18244-85-5_">cos-113-18244-85-5 Engine</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability (CVE-2024-26581) was discovered in the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-028">GCP-2024-028 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Media CDN</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Media CDN supports <a href="https://cloud.google.com/media-cdn/docs/custom-headers#header-variables">content targeting</a>, which helps you cache and deliver assets that are customized for your end-user contexts. It enables device characterization and geo-targeting, which are useful for implementing responsive websites, language customization, and currency settings.</p>\n<h2 detector is available in all regions. The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/resource-usage#disk_quota">disk quota</a> will change from Persistent disk standard (GB) to Persistent disk SSD (GB). Please check the Persistent disk SSD (GB) quota in your project and request an increase if this quota approaches its limit.</p>\n\n<p>A single environment created using a Small environment preset requires at least 600 GB SSD disk space and the SSD quota must be able to accommodate it.</p>\n\n<p>Being close to the limit of the SSD quota might impact the autoscaling capabilities of Cloud Composer environments or make impossible to create new environments.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-2/enable-saving-logs-to-environment-bucket">Logs in Cloud Logging Only</a> feature is enabled by default in new environments:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>New Cloud Composer environments now save Airflow task logs only in Cloud Logging by default.</li>\n<li>Existing environments are not changed. If you upgrade an existing environment to Cloud Composer 2.8.0, it keeps saving logs to the environment\'s bucket.</li>\n<li>You can enable and disable saving logs to the environment\'s bucket for an existing environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed a problem where some Airflow tasks were failing because the task could not write logs to the environment\'s bucket.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Cloud Composer 2.8.0</strong> <a href="https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/concepts/versioning/composer-versions">images</a> are available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>composer-2.8.0-airflow-2.7.3 (default)</li>\n<li>composer-2.8.0-airflow-2.6.3</li>\n</ul>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Composer</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Starting from GKE version 1.27.5, Cloud Composer environment clusters will start using SSD disks as persistent disks. The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/resource-usage#disk_quota">disk quota</a> will change from Persistent disk standard (GB) to Persistent disk SSD (GB). Please check the Persistent disk SSD (GB) quota in your project and request an increase if this quota approaches its limit.</p>\n\n<p>A single environment created using a Small environment preset requires at least 600 GB SSD disk space and the SSD quota must be able to accommodate it.</p>\n\n<p>Being close to the limit of the SSD quota might impact the autoscaling capabilities of Cloud Composer environments or make impossible to create new environments.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/composer-2/enable-saving-logs-to-environment-bucket">Logs in Cloud Logging Only</a> feature is enabled by default in new environments:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>New Cloud Composer environments now save Airflow task logs only in Cloud Logging by default.</li>\n<li>Existing environments are not changed. If you upgrade an existing environment to Cloud Composer 2.8.0, it keeps saving logs to the environment\'s bucket.</li>\n<li>You can enable and disable saving logs to the environment\'s bucket for an existing environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Fixed a problem where some Airflow tasks were failing because the task could not write logs to the environment\'s bucket.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p><strong>Cloud Composer 2.8.0</strong> <a href="https://cloud.google.com/composer/docs/concepts/versioning/composer-versions">images</a> are available:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>composer-2.8.0-airflow-2.7.3 (default)</li>\n<li>composer-2.8.0-airflow-2.6.3</li>\n</ul>'}, {'title': 'May 10, 2024', 'title_detail': {'type': 'text/plain', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://cloud.google.com/feeds/gcp-release-notes.xml', 'value': 'May 10, 2024'}, 'id': 'tag:google.com,2016:gcp-release-notes#May_10_2024', 'guidislink': True, 'link': 'https://cloud.google.com/release-notes#May_10_2024', 'updated': '2024-05-10T00:00:00-07:00', 'updated_parsed': time.struct_time(tm_year=2024, tm_mon=5, tm_mday=10, tm_hour=7, tm_min=0, tm_sec=0, tm_wday=4, tm_yday=131, tm_isdst=0), 'links': [{'rel': 'alternate', 'href': 'https://cloud.google.com/release-notes#May_10_2024', 'type': 'text/html'}], 'content': [{'type': 'text/html', 'language': None, 'base': 'https://cloud.google.com/feeds/gcp-release-notes.xml', 'value': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">AlloyDB for PostgreSQL</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Model endpoint management is now available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">Preview</a> for both AlloyDB and AlloyDB Omni. If your API proxies or revisions contain more than one basepath, the total number of basepaths per environment must not exceed 500.</p>\n\n<p>To track the status of this issue, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/release/known-issues">Apigee Known Issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now configure a logs panel widget to display log entries by log view. If your API proxies or revisions contain more than one basepath, the total number of basepaths per environment must not exceed 500.</p>\n\n<p>To track the status of this issue, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/release/known-issues">Apigee Known Issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now configure a logs panel widget to display log entries by log view. X</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 8, 2024, we released an updated version of Apigee X.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>This release contains the\xa0<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">General Availability (GA)</a>\xa0release of AppGroups for Apigee and Apigee hybrid (version 1.10.0 and later).</p>\n\n<p>AppGroups represent a relationship between one or more apps that are managed by the same set of people. For information, see\xa0<a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/organizing-client-app-ownership#using-appgroups-to-organize-app-ownership">Using AppGroups to organize app ownership</a>.\nClient support for AppGroups is available with the latest\xa0Drupal Teams module.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Life Sciences</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The migration documentation has been updated to explain how to use workflow services that you have configured for Cloud Life Sciences with Batch instead. Specifically, the documentation mentions Workflows from Google Cloud, Cromwell, dsub, Nextflow, and Snakemake. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/batch/docs/migrate-to-batch-from-cloud-life-sciences#workflow_services">Workflow services</a> in the Batch migration documentation.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Preview</strong>: You can now use the <strong>Require OS Config</strong> organization policy constraint to automatically enable VM Manager for all new VMs in your organization, folder, or project. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/manage-os#enable-vmm-org-policy">Enable VM Manager using an organization policy</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc-serverless/docs/concepts/versions/spark-runtime-versions">Dataproc Serverless for Spark runtime versions</a>: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>1.1.61</li>\n<li>1.2.5</li>\n<li>2.0.69</li>\n<li>2.1.48</li>\n<li>2.2.5</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dialogflow</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Dialogflow ES and Dialogflow CX: The <code>us-dialogflow.googleapis.com</code> endpoint and <code>locations/us</code> resource location, which served as aliases for global resources, will be discontinued starting May 21, 2024. We have changed the date\nto update resource locations and endpoints from April 16, 2024 to May 21, 2024 to provide you with additional time. For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/data/us-deprecation.pdf">email announcement</a>.</p>\n\n<p>Note</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>This change affects only the agents created in the <code>global</code> region (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/how/region">ES</a>,  <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/region">CX</a>) and only if you use the <code>us</code> alias in the API requests to these global-region agents. If you created agents in <code>us-central1</code>, <code>us-east1</code>, <code>us-west1</code>, and <code>us</code> (multi-region) regions, no action is required.</li>\n<li>The discontinued endpoint is different than the <code>us</code> multi-region endpoint that was <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/release-notes#April_23_2024">announced recently</a>. </li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI Agents: Effective June 15, 2024, the following <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/generative">generative features</a> will be upgraded from text-bison-001 and fine-tuned text-bison@001 options to gemini-1.0-pro-001:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Vertex AI agent apps</li>\n<li>Data store agents (aka Chat agents)</li>\n<li>Generators</li>\n<li>Generative fallback</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/data/text-bison-001-to-gemini-1.0-pro-001.pdf">email announcement</a></p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Architecture Center</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>(New guide) <a href="https://cloud.google.com/architecture/partners/c3-ai-architecture">C3 AI architecture on Google Cloud</a>: Develop applications using C3 AI and Google Cloud.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for VMware</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability (CVE-2024-26643) was discovered in the Linux the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-027">GCP-2024-027 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h4 id="2024-r13_version_updates">(2024-R13) Version updates</h4>\n\n<p>The following Kubernetes versions are now available for new clusters and for\nopt-in control plane upgrades and node upgrades for existing clusters. For more\ninformation on versioning and upgrades, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/versioning">GKE versioning and support</a>\nand <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/upgrades">Upgrades</a>.</p>\n<div class="ds-selector-tabs">\n<section><h3>No channel</h3><aside class="note"><strong>Note:</strong><span> Your clusters might not have these versions available. node versions are now available:\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CHANGELOG/CHANGELOG-1.26.md#v12614">1.26.14-gke.1044001</a></li>\n<li><a release.</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability (CVE-2024-26643) was discovered in the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-026">GCP-2024-026 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The 2024-R13 release notes were updated on June 7th, 2024 with the following:</p>\n\n<p><strong>Regular channel</strong></p>\n\n<p>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Regular channel were <strong>not</strong> upgraded from version 1.28 to version 1.29.1-gke.1589018. That release note was published by mistake</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The 2024-R13 release notes were updated on June 7th, 2024 with the following:</p>\n\n<p><strong>Regular channel</strong></p>\n\n<p>Control planes and nodes with auto-upgrade enabled in the Regular channel were <strong>not</strong> upgraded from version 1.28 to version 1.29.1-gke.1589018. release.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>When Applied Threat Intelligence is enabled, it ingests IOCs curated by Mandiant Threat Intelligence with an IC-Score greater than 80 and generates an alert when a match is found.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps SIEM</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>When Applied Threat Intelligence is enabled, it ingests IOCs curated by Mandiant Threat Intelligence with an IC-Score greater than 80 and generates an alert when a match is found.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps SOAR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Release 6.3.2 is currently in Preview. </p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Issues when  <code>Siemplify &gt; Set Case SLA</code> actions run at the exact same time (ID #49397338)</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Wrong error message displays when you to try add a custom list with a name that already exists (ID #50610331)</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>User mentioned in case not receiving an email notification (ID #00274991)</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Widgets not fully aligned on Case view page (ID #49711925)</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Number increased for integer type integration parameters (ID #00287205)</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Looker</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p><strong>Looker 24.8</strong>  includes the following changes, features, and fixes:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><p>Expected Looker (original) deployment start: <strong>Monday, May 13, 2024</strong></p></li>\n<li><p>Expected Looker (original) final deployment and download available: <strong>Thursday, May 23, 2024</strong> </p></li>\n<li><p>Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) deployment start: <strong>Monday, May 13, 2024</strong></p></li>\n<li><p>Expected Looker (Google Cloud core) final deployment: <strong>Monday, May 20, 2024</strong></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-connection-pooling">Database connection pooling</a> is becoming generally available. For Looker (original) instances, the feature is moved out of <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs">Looker Labs</a>. For <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-connection-pooling#dialect_support_for_database_connection_pooling">dialects that support database connection pooling</a>, the Connection settings page will include a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connecting-to-your-db#database-connection-pooling">Database Connection Pooling</a> option. As part of this update, the Database Connection Pooling Labs setting for your instance has been applied to the Database Connection Pooling setting for the applicable database connections on your instance. If you very recently changed the Database Connection Pooling Labs setting, please check your connection settings to verify that the migration has applied the Database Connection Pooling setting that you want for each database connection.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The <code>last_logged_in_at</code> time is now captured when a URL that is created by the <code>create_embed_url</code> is used to log in to the Looker instance. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, queries for totals would not run when a derived table referenced an ephemeral derived table using the <code>SQL_TABLE_NAME</code> syntax. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed with the scrollbar appearing in text tiles. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed where embed download filter parameters for cookieless embed were incorrectly escaped (space mapped to x2B [+] rather than x20). This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed where   characters were being reversed in single value visualizations. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Text is now properly truncated in table visualizations even when the underlying field has defined <code>html</code> and <code>link</code> parameters.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, an issue could cause Look titles to be cut off. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, an issue caused filters to be incorrectly restored in the dashboard edit filter dialog. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, if Looker encountered an invalid visualization type on a tile, the dashboard would not load. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, queries that were defined with the API occasionally could not be downloaded as PNGs or JPGs. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Quick start queries with missing identifiers will no longer cause validation to fail.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Referencing the <code>ALL_FIELDS</code> set in a join or view will no longer cause validation to fail.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>You can now see longer embedded Look titles without needing to scroll.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>For LookML projects with a large number of files, IDE folders were slow to respond when you were navigating and creating, editing, or deleting LookML files. A performance issue has been identified and fixed.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>When you search for a user or group, strings with commas now work as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue where paper size did not change correctly when Fit to Dashboard was used has been fixed. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, when embedded Explores were rendered in an iframe, a screen jump might have occurred. This feature now performs as expected. </p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, query downloads of type <code>json_bi</code> could have failed if they included fields that were hidden from the visualization. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Looker now initializes Development Mode projects for Looker projects that are in Production Mode.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Text in the project IDE will now be line wrapped.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>When a Git project becomes corrupted, Looker now proactively converts it to a clone to prevent further issues.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>When a LookML project fails to load, a log message will now be generated.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The log error about getting an access token from the Google OAuth library has been reclassified as a warning.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>When a custom filter is too large for the JSON parser to handle, Looker now returns a more descriptive error.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>HSQLDB has been updated to version 2.7.2 to comply with GHSA-77xx-rxvh-q682.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>On the Looker Labs page, links to documentation will now open in a new browser tab instead of navigating away from the Looker UI.</p>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos clusters on AWS</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability Azure</h2>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>A vulnerability (CVE-2024-26808) was discovered in the Linux kernel that can lead to a privilege escalation on Container-Optimized OS and Ubuntu nodes. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/security-bulletins#gcp-2024-027">GCP-2024-027 security bulletin</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee X</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>On May 8, 2024, we released an updated version of Apigee X.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>This release contains the\xa0<a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/#product-launch-stages">General Availability (GA)</a>\xa0release of AppGroups for Apigee and Apigee hybrid (version 1.10.0 and later).</p>\n\n<p>AppGroups represent a relationship between one or more apps that are managed by the same set of people. For information, see\xa0<a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/publish/organizing-client-app-ownership#using-appgroups-to-organize-app-ownership">Using AppGroups to organize app ownership</a>.\nClient support for AppGroups is available with the latest\xa0Drupal Teams module.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Life Sciences</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The migration documentation has been updated to explain how to use workflow services that you have configured for Cloud Life Sciences with Batch instead. Specifically, the documentation mentions Workflows from Google Cloud, Cromwell, dsub, Nextflow, and Snakemake. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/batch/docs/migrate-to-batch-from-cloud-life-sciences#workflow_services">Workflow services</a> in the Batch migration documentation.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Compute Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Preview</strong>: You can now use the <strong>Require OS Config</strong> organization policy constraint to automatically enable VM Manager for all new VMs in your organization, folder, or project. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/manage-os#enable-vmm-org-policy">Enable VM Manager using an organization policy</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dataproc</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>New <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dataproc-serverless/docs/concepts/versions/spark-runtime-versions">Dataproc Serverless for Spark runtime versions</a>: </p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>1.1.61</li>\n<li>1.2.5</li>\n<li>2.0.69</li>\n<li>2.1.48</li>\n<li>2.2.5</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Dialogflow</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Dialogflow ES and Dialogflow CX: The <code>us-dialogflow.googleapis.com</code> endpoint and <code>locations/us</code> resource location, which served as aliases for global resources, will be discontinued starting May 21, 2024. We have changed the date\nto update resource locations and endpoints from April 16, 2024 to May 21, 2024 to provide you with additional time. For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/data/us-deprecation.pdf">email announcement</a>.</p>\n\n<p>Note</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>This change affects only the agents created in the <code>global</code> region (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/es/docs/how/region">ES</a>,  <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/region">CX</a>) and only if you use the <code>us</code> alias in the API requests to these global-region agents. If you created agents in <code>us-central1</code>, <code>us-east1</code>, <code>us-west1</code>, and <code>us</code> (multi-region) regions, no action is required.</li>\n<li>The discontinued endpoint is different than the <code>us</code> multi-region endpoint that was <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/release-notes#April_23_2024">announced recently</a>. </li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI Agents: Effective June 15, 2024, the following <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/cx/docs/concept/generative">generative features</a> will be upgraded from text-bison-001 and fine-tuned text-bison@001 options to gemini-1.0-pro-001:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Vertex AI agent apps</li>\n<li>Data store agents (aka Chat agents)</li>\n<li>Generators</li>\n<li>Generative fallback</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/data/text-bison-001-to-gemini-1.0-pro-001.pdf">email announcement</a></p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Architecture 20, 2024</strong></p></li>\n</ul>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-connection-pooling">Database connection pooling</a> is becoming generally available. For Looker (original) instances, the feature is moved out of <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/admin-panel-general-labs">Looker Labs</a>. For <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/db-connection-pooling#dialect_support_for_database_connection_pooling">dialects that support database connection pooling</a>, the Connection settings page will include a <a href="https://cloud.google.com/looker/docs/connecting-to-your-db#database-connection-pooling">Database Connection Pooling</a> option. As part of this update, the Database Connection Pooling Labs setting for your instance has been applied to the Database Connection Pooling setting for the applicable database connections on your instance. If you very recently changed the Database Connection Pooling Labs setting, please check your connection settings to verify that the migration has applied the Database Connection Pooling setting that you want for each database connection.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The <code>last_logged_in_at</code> time is now captured when a URL that is created by the <code>create_embed_url</code> is used to log in to the Looker instance. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, queries for totals would not run when a derived table referenced an ephemeral derived table using the <code>SQL_TABLE_NAME</code> syntax. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed with the scrollbar appearing in text tiles. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed where embed download filter parameters for cookieless embed were incorrectly escaped (space mapped to x2B [+] rather than x20). This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue has been fixed where   characters were being reversed in single value visualizations. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Text is now properly truncated in table visualizations even when the underlying field has defined <code>html</code> and <code>link</code> parameters.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, an issue could cause Look titles to be cut off. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, an issue caused filters to be incorrectly restored in the dashboard edit filter dialog. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, if Looker encountered an invalid visualization type on a tile, the dashboard would not load. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Previously, queries that were defined with the API occasionally could not be downloaded as PNGs or JPGs. This feature now performs as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Quick start queries with missing identifiers will no longer cause validation to fail.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>Referencing the <code>ALL_FIELDS</code> set in a join or view will no longer cause validation to fail.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>You can now see longer embedded Look titles without needing to scroll.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>For LookML projects with a large number of files, IDE folders were slow to respond when you were navigating and creating, editing, or deleting LookML files. A performance issue has been identified and fixed.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>When you search for a user or group, strings with commas now work as expected.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>An issue where paper size did not change correctly when Fit to Dashboard was used has been fixed. If set to <code>true</code>, SSL enforcement is applied to service callouts.</p>\n\n<p>The option to specify this behavior is analogous to usage of the <code>&lt;Enforce&gt;</code> tag in the <code>&lt;SSLInfo&gt;</code> block of the  TargetEndpoint configuration.  </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/deploy/load-balancing-across-backend-servers#configure-strict-ssl-enforcement">Configure strict SSL enforcement </a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Environment-level flag for SSL enforcement</strong></p>\n\n<p>Apigee customers can specify strict SSL southbound enforcement across an Apigee environment, using the <code>SSLInfo.Enforce</code> flag.</p>\n\n<p>If <code>SSLInfo.Enforce</code> is set to <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>, the value specified overrides any granular enforcement options specified in <code>&lt;SSLInfo&gt;</code> blocks in TargetEndpoint or TargetServer configurations.</p>\n\n<p>If <code>SSLInfo.Enforce</code> is unset, SSL enforcement is determined by any values specified using the <code>&lt;Enforce&gt;</code> element within individual <code>&lt;SSLInfo&gt;</code> blocks.\nFor more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/api-platform/reference/api-proxy-configuration-reference#tlsssltargetendpointconfiguration">TLS/SSL TargetEndpoint configuration</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Two-way HTTPS health monitor support</strong></p>\n\n<p>Apigee health monitors using <code>&lt;HTTPMonitor&gt;</code> can now use all SSL parameters available in the <code>&lt;SSLInfo&gt;</code> block of their TargetServer configurations when performing health checks.</p>\n\n<p>To enable access, set <code>&lt;UseTargetServerSSLInfo&gt;</code> to <code>true</code> in the <code>&lt;Request&gt;</code> block of the HTTPMonitor configuration. </p>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a Use API hub to accelerate the consistency, use, reuse, and governance of your API portfolio.</p>\n\n<p>Use API hub to:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Create and manage a complete catalog of your APIs and API resources.</li>\n<li>Add rich attributes to your APIs for tracking, organizing, and filtering.</li>\n<li>Link to one or more Apigee projects to automatically fetch and store Apigee API proxy information.</li>\n<li>Find APIs with powerful free-form semantic search capabilities.</li>\n<li>Track compliance for your API specification files using Linting functionality.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>To learn more about the features and functionality available, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/apihub/what-is-api-hub">What is Apigee API hub?</a></p>\n\n<p><strong>NOTE</strong>: Rollouts of this feature will begin on May 6, 2024, and may take four or more business days to be completed across all Google Cloud zones. You may not be able to provision API hub until the rollout is complete.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">AutoML Natural Language</h2>\n<h3>Deprecated</h3>\n<p>This legacy version of AutoML Natural Language is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/natural-language/automl/docs/deprecations">deprecated</a> and new models can no longer be trained nor deployed on the legacy platform. Already deployed models will stop working on May 30, 2024. All the functionality of legacy AutoML Natural Language and new features are available on the Vertex AI platform. See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/start/migrating-to-vertex-ai">Migrate to Vertex AI</a> to learn how to migrate your resources.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Backup and DR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Backup and DR Service 11.0.10.425 is now available to update your backup/recovery appliance. Refer to these <a href="https://cloud.google.com/backup-disaster-recovery/docs/configuration/update-appliance">instructions</a> to update your appliance. This release includes fixes for the following security vulnerabilities:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><a href="https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-35937">CVE-2021-35937</a></li>\n<li><a provides managed failover and redundant compute capacity for business critical workloads. It is intended for use in the case of a total region outage and is supported with the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/editions-intro">BigQuery Enterprise Plus edition</a> only. This feature is now available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">preview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now create <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/glue-federated-datasets">AWS Glue federated datasets</a> using the the Google Cloud console. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bigtable</h2>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A class="release-note-product-title">Certificate Authority Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Implement fine-grained policy controls over your certificate issuance using certificate templates. Certificate templates can be used in conjunction with IAM conditions to effectively create different policy controls for different users on the same CA pool. You can test certificate issuance in a validation mode and proactively identify conflicts between the CA pool\'s issuance policies and the certificate template\'s policies.  For information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/certificate-authority-service/docs/issue-certificate-using-template">Request a certificate using a certificate template</a>. The feature is in General Availability (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Asset Inventory</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following resource types are now publicly available through the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/exportAssets">ExportAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/listing-assets">ListAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/batchGetAssetsHistory">BatchGetAssetsHistory</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/queryAssets">QueryAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/feeds">Feed</a>, and Search (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/searchAllResources">SearchAllResources</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/searchAllIamPolicies">SearchAllIamPolicies</a>) APIs.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Compute Engine\n<ul>\n<li><code>compute.googleapis.com/StoragePool</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Billing</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Download committed use discount data as a CSV file</strong></p>\n\n<p>You can now download data about all your committed use discounts (CUD) as a flat comma-separated value (CSV) file. The CSV file includes the subscription ID for each commitment, which you can use join your CUDs data to your usage data in the BigQuery export.</p>\n\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/cuds-list-overview#download_csv">Learn about downloading your CUDs data</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Synthetic monitors no longer require that the ingress rule be set to allow all traffic. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/synthetic-monitors/create#function-configuration">Cloud Function configuration</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>A Selenium WebDriver sample is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/uptime-checks/introduction">synthetic monitors</a>. For more information, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/synthetic-monitors/samples#selenium-sample">Selenium WebDriver template</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Optimized OS</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h3 id="cos-101-17162-463-16_">cos-101-17162-463-16 <a id="cos-arm64-101-17162-463-16"></h3>\n\n<table class="pkg">\n  <tr>\n    <td>Kernel</td>\n    <td>Docker</td>\n    <td>Containerd</td>\n    <td>GPU Drivers</td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n    <td><a href="https://cos.googlesource.com/third_party/kernel/+/6df8b2fe474014977f6ded9b55866c0bd4c77275">COS-5.15.155</a></td>\n    <td>v20.10.27</td>\n    <td>v1.6.28</td>\n    <td>v470.239.06(default),v550.54.15(latest)</td>\n  </tr>\n</table>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2017-18207 in dev-lang/python.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2023-32681 in dev-python/requests.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Updated cos-gpu-installer to v2.3.0.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2022-2806 in app-admin/sosreport.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2023-0687, CVE-2024-2961, CVE-2024-33599, CVE-2024-33600, CVE-2024-33601, CVE-2024-33602 in sys-libs/glibc.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2021-37600, CVE-2021-3995, CVE-2021-3996 in sys-apps/util-linux.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Updated net-dns/c-ares to v1.27. class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Deploy</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Cloud Deploy now uses Skaffold 2.11 as the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/deploy/docs/using-skaffold/select-skaffold#supported_versions">default Skaffold version</a> for all target types.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Gemini for investigation assistance</strong></p>\n\n<p>Gemini for investigation assistance can now support you with the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Search</strong>: Gemini can help you build, edit, and run searches targeted toward relevant events using natural language prompts.</li>\n<li><strong>Search summaries</strong>: Gemini can automatically summarize search results after every search and subsequent filter action. Gemini can also answer contextual follow-up questions about the summaries it provides.</li>\n<li><strong>Rule generation</strong>: Gemini can create new YARA-L rules from the UDM search queries it generates.</li>\n<li><strong>Security questions and threat intelligence analysis</strong>: Gemini can answer general security domain questions and specific threat intelligence questions. Gemini can provide summaries about threat actors, IOCs, and other threat intelligence topics.</li>\n<li><strong>Incident remediation</strong>: Based on the event information returned, Gemini can suggest follow-on steps.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/secops/gemini-chronicle#investigation">Use Gemini to investigate security issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps SIEM</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Gemini for investigation assistance</strong></p>\n\n<p>Gemini for investigation assistance can now support you with the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Search</strong>: Gemini can help you build, edit, and run searches targeted toward relevant events using natural language prompts.</li>\n<li><strong>Search summaries</strong>: Gemini can automatically summarize search results after every search and subsequent filter action. Gemini can also answer contextual follow-up questions about the summaries it provides.</li>\n<li><strong>Rule generation</strong>: Gemini can create new YARA-L rules from the UDM search queries it generates.</li>\n<li><strong>Security questions and threat intelligence analysis</strong>: Gemini can answer general security domain questions and specific threat intelligence questions. Gemini can provide summaries about threat actors, IOCs, and other threat intelligence topics.</li>\n<li><strong>Incident remediation</strong>: Based on the event information returned, Gemini can suggest follow-on steps.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/secops/gemini-chronicle#investigation">Use Gemini to investigate security issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Identity-Aware Proxy</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP) now supports Workforce Identity Federation for application access. You can now use your extended workforce identities to access IAP-protected applications without having to sync your identities into Cloud Identity. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/iap/docs/use-workforce-identity-federation">Configure IAP with Workforce Identity Federation</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Migrate to Containers</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>The Migrate to Containers UI in the Google Cloud console, <code>migctl</code>, and CRDs that used processing clusters to migrate workloads to Google Cloud are no longer available.</p>\n\n<p>To perform migrations, use the Migrate to Containers CLI on your local machine. For more information, see <a href="https://www.cloud.google.com/migrate/containers/docs/getting-started">Migrate to Containers overview</a>.</p>\n\n<p>If you have any questions or require additional class="release-note-product-title">AlloyDB for PostgreSQL</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/alloydb/docs/manage-password-policy">set password policies for local database users</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Apigee Registry</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Apigee API hub is available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">preview</a>.</p>\n\n<p>With Apigee API hub, you can consolidate and organize critical information about your APIs in one place. Use API hub to accelerate the consistency, use, reuse, and governance of your API portfolio.</p>\n\n<p>Use API hub to:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Create and manage a complete catalog of your APIs and API resources.</li>\n<li>Add rich attributes to your APIs for tracking, organizing, and filtering.</li>\n<li>Link to one or more Apigee projects to automatically fetch and store Apigee API proxy information.</li>\n<li>Find APIs with powerful free-form semantic search capabilities.</li>\n<li>Track compliance for your API specification files using Linting functionality.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>To learn more about the features and functionality available, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/apigee/docs/apihub/what-is-api-hub">What is Apigee API hub?</a></p>\n\n<p><strong>NOTE</strong>: Rollouts of this feature will begin on May 6, 2024, and may take four or more business days to be completed across all Google Cloud zones. You may not be able to provision API hub until the rollout is complete.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">AutoML Natural Language</h2>\n<h3>Deprecated</h3>\n<p>This legacy version of AutoML Natural Language is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/natural-language/automl/docs/deprecations">deprecated</a> and new models can no longer be trained nor deployed on the legacy platform. Already deployed models will stop working on May 30, 2024. All the functionality of legacy AutoML Natural Language and new features are available on the Vertex AI platform. See <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/docs/start/migrating-to-vertex-ai">Migrate to Vertex AI</a> to learn how to migrate your resources.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Backup and DR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Backup and DR Service 11.0.10.425 is now available to update your backup/recovery appliance. provides managed failover and redundant compute capacity for business critical workloads. It is intended for use in the case of a total region outage and is supported with the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/editions-intro">BigQuery Enterprise Plus edition</a> only. This feature is now available in <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">preview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now create <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/glue-federated-datasets">AWS Glue federated datasets</a> using the the Google Cloud console. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bigtable</h2>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A href="https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigtable/commit/3f37d8da8b51a3fea56d1c462b9500ee2c244973" rel="noreferrer noopener" target="_blank">3f37d8d</a>)</li>\n</ul></section>\n</div>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Certificate Authority Service</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Implement fine-grained policy controls over your certificate issuance using certificate templates. Certificate templates can be used in conjunction with IAM conditions to effectively create different policy controls for different users on the same CA pool. You can test certificate issuance in a validation mode and proactively identify conflicts between the CA pool\'s issuance policies and the certificate template\'s policies.  For information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/certificate-authority-service/docs/issue-certificate-using-template">Request a certificate using a certificate template</a>. The feature is in General Availability (GA).</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Asset Inventory</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The following resource types are now publicly available through the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/exportAssets">ExportAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/listing-assets">ListAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/batchGetAssetsHistory">BatchGetAssetsHistory</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/queryAssets">QueryAssets</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/feeds">Feed</a>, and Search (<a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/searchAllResources">SearchAllResources</a>, <a href="https://cloud.google.com/asset-inventory/docs/reference/rest/v1/TopLevel/searchAllIamPolicies">SearchAllIamPolicies</a>) APIs.</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Compute Engine\n<ul>\n<li><code>compute.googleapis.com/StoragePool</code></li>\n</ul></li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Billing</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Download committed use discount data as a CSV file</strong></p>\n\n<p>You can now download data about all your committed use discounts (CUD) as a flat comma-separated value (CSV) file. The CSV file includes the subscription ID for each commitment, which you can use join your CUDs data to your usage data in the BigQuery export.</p>\n\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/billing/docs/how-to/cuds-list-overview#download_csv">Learn about downloading your CUDs data</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Cloud Monitoring</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Synthetic monitors no longer require that the ingress rule be set to allow all traffic. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/synthetic-monitors/create#function-configuration">Cloud Function configuration</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>A Selenium WebDriver sample is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/uptime-checks/introduction">synthetic monitors</a>. For more information, see\n<a href="https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/synthetic-monitors/samples#selenium-sample">Selenium WebDriver template</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Container Optimized OS</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<h3 id="cos-101-17162-463-16_">cos-101-17162-463-16 <a id="cos-arm64-101-17162-463-16"></h3>\n\n<table class="pkg">\n  <tr>\n    <td>Kernel</td>\n    <td>Docker</td>\n    <td>Containerd</td>\n    <td>GPU Drivers</td>\n  </tr>\n  <tr>\n    <td><a href="https://cos.googlesource.com/third_party/kernel/+/6df8b2fe474014977f6ded9b55866c0bd4c77275">COS-5.15.155</a></td>\n    <td>v20.10.27</td>\n    <td>v1.6.28</td>\n    <td>v470.239.06(default),v550.54.15(latest)</td>\n  </tr>\n</table>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2017-18207 in dev-lang/python.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2023-32681 in dev-python/requests.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Updated cos-gpu-installer to v2.3.0.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2022-2806 in app-admin/sosreport.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2023-0687, CVE-2024-2961, CVE-2024-33599, CVE-2024-33600, CVE-2024-33601, CVE-2024-33602 in sys-libs/glibc.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Fixed CVE-2021-37600, CVE-2021-3995, CVE-2021-3996 in sys-apps/util-linux.</p>\n<h3>Security</h3>\n<p>Updated net-dns/c-ares to v1.27. class="release-note-product-title">Google Cloud Deploy</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Cloud Deploy now uses Skaffold 2.11 as the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/deploy/docs/using-skaffold/select-skaffold#supported_versions">default Skaffold version</a> for all target types.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Gemini for investigation assistance</strong></p>\n\n<p>Gemini for investigation assistance can now support you with the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Search</strong>: Gemini can help you build, edit, and run searches targeted toward relevant events using natural language prompts.</li>\n<li><strong>Search summaries</strong>: Gemini can automatically summarize search results after every search and subsequent filter action. Gemini can also answer contextual follow-up questions about the summaries it provides.</li>\n<li><strong>Rule generation</strong>: Gemini can create new YARA-L rules from the UDM search queries it generates.</li>\n<li><strong>Security questions and threat intelligence analysis</strong>: Gemini can answer general security domain questions and specific threat intelligence questions. Gemini can provide summaries about threat actors, IOCs, and other threat intelligence topics.</li>\n<li><strong>Incident remediation</strong>: Based on the event information returned, Gemini can suggest follow-on steps.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/secops/gemini-chronicle#investigation">Use Gemini to investigate security issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps SIEM</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Gemini for investigation assistance</strong></p>\n\n<p>Gemini for investigation assistance can now support you with the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li><strong>Search</strong>: Gemini can help you build, edit, and run searches targeted toward relevant events using natural language prompts.</li>\n<li><strong>Search summaries</strong>: Gemini can automatically summarize search results after every search and subsequent filter action. Gemini can also answer contextual follow-up questions about the summaries it provides.</li>\n<li><strong>Rule generation</strong>: Gemini can create new YARA-L rules from the UDM search queries it generates.</li>\n<li><strong>Security questions and threat intelligence analysis</strong>: Gemini can answer general security domain questions and specific threat intelligence questions. Gemini can provide summaries about threat actors, IOCs, and other threat intelligence topics.</li>\n<li><strong>Incident remediation</strong>: Based on the event information returned, Gemini can suggest follow-on steps.</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/chronicle/docs/secops/gemini-chronicle#investigation">Use Gemini to investigate security issues</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Identity-Aware Proxy</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Identity-Aware Proxy (IAP) now supports Workforce Identity Federation for application access. You can now use your extended workforce identities to access IAP-protected applications without having to sync your identities into Cloud Identity. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/iap/docs/use-workforce-identity-federation">Configure IAP with Workforce Identity Federation</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Migrate to Containers</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>The Migrate to Containers UI in the Google Cloud console, <code>migctl</code>, and CRDs that used processing clusters to migrate workloads to Google Cloud are no longer available.</p>\n\n<p>To perform migrations, use the Migrate to Containers CLI on your local machine. For more information, see <a href="https://www.cloud.google.com/migrate/containers/docs/getting-started">Migrate to Containers overview</a>.</p>\n\n<p>If you have any questions or require additional support, then reach out to <a href="mailto:m2c-external-feedback@google.com">m2c-external-feedback@google.com</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Pub/Sub</h2>\n<h3>Libraries</h3>\n<p>A Management</h2>\n<h3>Breaking</h3>\n<p>Installing Policy Controller 1.18.0 or newer will fail unless you first enable the <code>anthospolicycontroller.googleapis.com</code> API. For more information on directly installing and managing Policy Controller, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/installing-policy-controller#gcloud-policy-controller">Install Policy Controller</a>. </p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Dynamic namespace selection using the <code>spec.mode</code> field in the NamespaceSelector CRD is now generally available (GA). This feature supports deploying namespace-scoped resources in matching Namespaces statically-declared in the source of truth and dynamically present on the cluster. For more information, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/namespace-scoped-objects#namespaceselector_mode">NamespaceSelector mode</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Config Sync now supports specifying CA certificates for helm and OCI source types. This is surfaced on the <code>caCertSecretRef</code> field on the RootSync and RepoSync APIs. For more information, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/reference/rootsync-reposync-fields">RootSync and RepoSync fields</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Policy Controller bundles have been updated to the following versions: <code>cis-gke-v1.5.0</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>nist-sp-800-190</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>nist-sp-800-53-r5</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pci-dss-v3.2.1</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pci-dss-v4.0</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>policy-essentials-v2022</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pss-baseline-v2022</code>: <code>202403.1</code>, <code>pss-restricted-v2022</code>: <code>202403.1</code>. For reference, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/concepts/policy-controller-bundles">Policy Controller bundles overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>When syncing from Helm, Config Sync now retries faster on errors with exponential backoff.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Reduced memory footprint in reconcilers by not loading the OpenAPI when the Config Sync admission webhook is disabled.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>On Autopilot clusters, the <code>helm-sync</code> container CPU request is changed from 150m to 250m, and memory request is changed from 256Mi to 384Mi. For information on resource requirements, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/installing-config-sync#resource_requests">Resource requests</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Upgraded bundled Helm version from v3.13.3 to <a href="https://github.com/helm/helm/releases/tag/v3.14.3">v3.14.3</a> to pick up vulnerability fixes. To understand the changes in each release, review the <a href="https://github.com/helm/helm/releases">changelogs</a>.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Policy Controller now has its own release notes page. For future announcements, visit <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/enterprise/policy-controller/docs/release-notes">Policy Controller release notes</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bare Metal Solution</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/view-infrastructure-metrics">set up Ops Agent on your Bare Metal Solution server</a> to view Bare Metal Solution metrics. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Bare Metal Solution now supports Oracle Linux 9. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/bms-planning#operating_systems">Operating systems</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/bms-maintenance#change-os-for-server">Change the OS for a server</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-subscriptions">Analytics Hub Subscription Management</a> is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA). Data Publishers can now manage their subscriptions, view information about their subscribers, and revoke access to their data at any time.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-monitor-listings">Analytics Hub Provider Usage Metrics</a> is now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA). The usage metrics include the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Jobs that run against your shared data.</li>\n<li>The consumption details of your shared data by subscribers\' projects and organizations.</li>\n<li>The number of rows and bytes processed by the job.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bigtable</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/use-bigtable-spark-connector">Bigtable Spark connector</a> lets you read and write data from and to Bigtable using Spark SQL and DataFrames inside your Spark application. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Filestore</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/revert-snapshot">revert an instance to a snapshot state</a>. This feature is <a href="http://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> for instances created in the zonal and enterprise service tiers.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Filestore supports <a href="https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/csi-driver#ipacl">IP-based access control for your volumes</a>. You can now use the Filestore CSI driver to configure IP-based access control at volume creation.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_128500-gke120">Release 1.28.500-gke.120</h3>\n\n<p>GKE on Bare Metal 1.28.500-gke.120 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. GKE on Bare Metal 1.28.500-gke.120 runs on Kubernetes 1.28.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">GDCV Ready storage partners</a> document to make sure the storage vendor has already passed the qualification for this release of GKE on Bare Metal.</p>\n<h3>Fixed</h3>\n<p>The following container image the latest known issues, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/troubleshooting/known-issues">GKE on Bare Metal known issues</a> in the Troubleshooting section.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The new release of the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/gateway-api#gateway_controller">GKE Gateway controller</a> (2024-R1) is now <strong>generally available</strong>. With this release, the GKE Gateway controller will provide the following new capabilities and fixes:</p>\n\n<p><strong>New capabilities:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Gateway API CRDs v1.0.0</li>\n<li>Cloud Armor backend security policy support for Regional external Gateways</li>\n<li>Self-managed certificates with Certificate Manager on Regional internal &amp; external Gateways</li>\n<li>Google-managed certificates with Certificate Manager on Regional internal &amp; external Gateways [<strong>Preview</strong>]</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><strong>Bug fixes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Fixed missing permissions to MCI service agent role for regional SSL policy</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>To learn more about our GKE Gateway controller capabilities, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/gatewayclass-capabilities">supported capabilities per GatewayClass</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Starting in GKE 1.30, the metric <code>scheduler_pod_scheduling_duration_seconds</code> in <a href="http://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/control-plane-metrics#scheduler">control plane metrics package</a> will no longer be available, as a result of <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/119049">deprecation in the upstream OSS</a>. The replacement metric <code>scheduler_pod_scheduling_sli_duration_seconds</code> will be exported as part of the the control plane metrics package instead.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The following supported default parsers have changed. (<code>VEZA</code>)</li>\n<li>Web Methods Api Gateway (<code>WEBMETHODS_API_GATEWAY</code>)</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>For a list of supported log types and details about default parser changes, see <a SOAR</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Remote Agents Release 1.6.0  is currently in Preview.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Jobs can now be run remotely over remote agents. </p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Looker Studio</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><strong>Chart titles</strong></p>\n\n<p>You can now add a title directly to a chart in Looker Studio.\nYou can customize the title\'s font, color, size, styling, and positioning within the Title section of the Style tab of the properties panel.</p>\n\n<p><a Cloud</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Service producers are no longer charged producer data processing for ingress or egress traffic through a Private Service Connect service attachment. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/pricing#psc-service-attachment">pricing for published services</a>.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Private Service Connect now offers consumers volume-based discounts for consumer data processing. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/pricing#psc-consumer-data-processing">Consumer data processing</a>.</p>'}], 'summary': '<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Anthos Config Management</h2>\n<h3>Breaking</h3>\n<p>Installing Policy Controller 1.18.0 or newer will fail unless you first enable the <code>anthospolicycontroller.googleapis.com</code> API. For more information on directly installing and managing Policy Controller, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/installing-policy-controller#gcloud-policy-controller">Install Policy Controller</a>. </p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Dynamic namespace selection using the <code>spec.mode</code> field in the NamespaceSelector CRD is now generally available (GA). This feature supports deploying namespace-scoped resources in matching Namespaces statically-declared in the source of truth and dynamically present on the cluster. For more information, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/namespace-scoped-objects#namespaceselector_mode">NamespaceSelector mode</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Config Sync now supports specifying CA certificates for helm and OCI source types. This is surfaced on the <code>caCertSecretRef</code> field on the RootSync and RepoSync APIs. For more information, refer to <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/reference/rootsync-reposync-fields">RootSync and RepoSync fields</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Policy Controller bundles have been updated to the following versions: <code>cis-gke-v1.5.0</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>nist-sp-800-190</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>nist-sp-800-53-r5</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pci-dss-v3.2.1</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pci-dss-v4.0</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>policy-essentials-v2022</code>: <code>202403.0</code>, <code>pss-baseline-v2022</code>: <code>202403.1</code>, <code>pss-restricted-v2022</code>: <code>202403.1</code>. For reference, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/concepts/policy-controller-bundles">Policy Controller bundles overview</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>When syncing from Helm, Config Sync now retries faster on errors with exponential backoff.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Reduced memory footprint in reconcilers by not loading the OpenAPI when the Config Sync admission webhook is disabled.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>On Autopilot clusters, the <code>helm-sync</code> container CPU request is changed from 150m to 250m, and memory request is changed from 256Mi to 384Mi. For information on resource requirements, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos-config-management/docs/how-to/installing-config-sync#resource_requests">Resource requests</a>.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Upgraded bundled Helm version from v3.13.3 to <a href="https://github.com/helm/helm/releases/tag/v3.14.3">v3.14.3</a> to pick up vulnerability fixes. To understand the changes in each release, review the <a href="https://github.com/helm/helm/releases">changelogs</a>.</p>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<p>Policy Controller now has its own release notes page. For future announcements, visit <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/enterprise/policy-controller/docs/release-notes">Policy Controller release notes</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bare Metal Solution</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/view-infrastructure-metrics">set up Ops Agent on your Bare Metal Solution server</a> to view Bare Metal Solution metrics. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Bare Metal Solution now supports Oracle Linux 9. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>. For more information, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/bms-planning#operating_systems">Operating systems</a> and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bare-metal/docs/bms-maintenance#change-os-for-server">Change the OS for a server</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">BigQuery</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-manage-subscriptions">Analytics Hub Subscription Management</a> is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA). Data Publishers can now manage their subscriptions, view information about their subscribers, and revoke access to their data at any time.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p><a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/analytics-hub-monitor-listings">Analytics Hub Provider Usage Metrics</a> is now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> (GA). The usage metrics include the following:</p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Jobs that run against your shared data.</li>\n<li>The consumption details of your shared data by subscribers\' projects and organizations.</li>\n<li>The number of rows and bytes processed by the job.</li>\n</ul>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Bigtable</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The <a href="https://cloud.google.com/bigtable/docs/use-bigtable-spark-connector">Bigtable Spark connector</a> lets you read and write data from and to Bigtable using Spark SQL and DataFrames inside your Spark application. This feature is <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available (GA)</a>.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Filestore</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>You can now <a href="https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/revert-snapshot">revert an instance to a snapshot state</a>. This feature is <a href="http://cloud.google.com/products#product-launch-stages">generally available</a> for instances created in the zonal and enterprise service tiers.</p>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>Filestore supports <a href="https://cloud.google.com/filestore/docs/csi-driver#ipacl">IP-based access control for your volumes</a>. You can now use the Filestore CSI driver to configure IP-based access control at volume creation.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Distributed Cloud (software only) for Bare Metal</h2>\n<h3>Announcement</h3>\n<h3 id="release_128500-gke120">Release 1.28.500-gke.120</h3>\n\n<p>GKE on Bare Metal 1.28.500-gke.120 is now available for <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/downloads">download</a>. To upgrade, see <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/clusters/docs/bare-metal/latest/how-to/upgrade">Upgrade clusters</a>. GKE on Bare Metal 1.28.500-gke.120 runs on Kubernetes 1.28.</p>\n\n<p>If you use a third-party storage vendor, check the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/anthos/docs/resources/partner-storage">GDCV section.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google Kubernetes Engine</h2>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>The new release of the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/concepts/gateway-api#gateway_controller">GKE Gateway controller</a> (2024-R1) is now <strong>generally available</strong>. With this release, the GKE Gateway controller will provide the following new capabilities and fixes:</p>\n\n<p><strong>New capabilities:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Gateway API CRDs v1.0.0</li>\n<li>Cloud Armor backend security policy support for Regional external Gateways</li>\n<li>Self-managed certificates with Certificate Manager on Regional internal &amp; external Gateways</li>\n<li>Google-managed certificates with Certificate Manager on Regional internal &amp; external Gateways [<strong>Preview</strong>]</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p><strong>Bug fixes:</strong></p>\n\n<ul>\n<li>Fixed missing permissions to MCI service agent role for regional SSL policy</li>\n</ul>\n\n<p>To learn more about our GKE Gateway controller capabilities, see the <a href="https://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/gatewayclass-capabilities">supported capabilities per GatewayClass</a>.</p>\n<h3>Feature</h3>\n<p>Starting in GKE 1.30, the metric <code>scheduler_pod_scheduling_duration_seconds</code> in <a href="http://cloud.google.com/kubernetes-engine/docs/how-to/control-plane-metrics#scheduler">control plane metrics package</a> will no longer be available, as a result of <a href="https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/119049">deprecation in the upstream OSS</a>. The replacement metric <code>scheduler_pod_scheduling_sli_duration_seconds</code> will be exported as part of the the control plane metrics package instead.</p>\n<h2 class="release-note-product-title">Google SecOps</h2>\n<h3>Changed</h3>\n<p>The following supported default parsers have changed.
